review_detailed_main: Why why why that's all I kept saying to myself. First off maybe they could of done a good home alone film if it was done right but no it was done awful. review_title: I regret all the decisions which have led me to this point
review_detailed_main:
It's hard to really rage over HOME SWEET HOME ALONE because I am 99% convinced Disney never intended for this thing to be good or even an alternative to the original HOME ALONE. They needed more content for the Disney + subscription service, no matter how insipid or cheap, and so here we are.

There's really not much to say about it-- it looks cheap, the acting is bad, and the writing is beyond hope. They try twisting on the usual formula by making the burglars sympathetic but this actually works against what has made the original HOME ALONE so popular over the last 30 years. Harry and Marv were absolutely in the wrong, and they were at the bare minimum a threat should they catch Kevin (I absolutely believe Joe Pesci when he threatens to bite that kid's fingers off), so all those gloriously violent booby trap sequences are way more fun. Here, my sympathy is with the thieves, who receive far more development than the main character, so it isn't fun watching them get hurt.

Also-- and this might be just me-- but is anyone else sick of the thick layers of Joss Whedon-esque irony that suffuses so many American movies now? It was funny and fresh in small doses years ago, but it's gotten old already. The dialogue in this movie is made even more obnoxious by the fact that everyone, from the kids to the Gen X adults, talk like stereotypes of millenials/Gen Z-ers-- you know, "Oh wow, we left the kid home alone, hashtag reboot."

The film has no redeeming moments. By far the worst of the franchise. They could head in so many directions and even use original casting to bring the franchise back but once again they've dug up an old title and made a hollow, soulless movie.. it looks and feels like a low budget sitcom. Director, cast and production all just dreadful. File this one under "should not have happened" but again in todays industry its about quantity not quality. Everyone involved got paid well but they'll probably regret doing this one later on in their careers..

review_title: Why does this movie even exist??
review_detailed_main:
The original two Home Alone movies that starred the charismatic Macaulay Culkin and the legendary Joe Pesci have been staples of Christmas movies now for more than a generation of children and adults alike. The central concept of a child being left at home and enjoying the freedom while at the same time having to stop his house from being robbed by two wannabe thieves trying to hit it big in the very nice neighbourhood. The second movie takes the core concept and twists it and has Kevin McCallister alone in New York City, the stakes are raised and the bumbling theives are back to exact there revenge on Kevin. The films are also peppered with feel good moments and interesting side characters and lessons about caring for your family.

So why make another movie??? What made the original movies so good was that the stories were unique and special at thr time. Also they had many excellent actresses and actors that brought the idea to life.... The story has been told. Nothing unique to the core story comes from this new movie. The only original characrer it has is Buzz who was a minor character before (and he was good)..... One can say that yes this movie uses new tricks that Kevin wouldn't have had in 1990. Yet just changing up that alone doesn't warrant a new movie and the story is nowhere near as good as the original two. You would wonder why Disney doesn't try to create something new and special for new generations of kids to hold on to. Instead of recycled ideas that weren't requested by annyone. So 1 out of 10... I don't blame the actors and actresses here. They're ok at their portrayal of the characters. But regardless the story underneath is like a thinly gold plated copper ring while the true 24 carat gold movie came out in 1990. Just avoid this movie, watch the amazing originals like I do each year or see some amazing content from elsewhere.

It may end up looking better than both the 4th and 5th adaptation (yes there are 6 of these movies now), but Home Sweet Home Alone lacks any charisma, wit, or charm that made the original films so enjoyable and ends up feeling like an incredibly pointless and quite dated forced reboot comedy. The first thing that sticks out to me so clearly about this film is how painfully unfunny it is. Almost every minute of this film they try so hard to make each joke work and nothing ever lands, and instead your stuck watching the awkwardness unfold slower and slower until you can hardly stand to take it anymore. The actors are thankfully better than the last two adaptations, with some big names to star, however that doesn't mean they are by any means good in their roles- and again feels like the film missed a major opportunity. So many huge comedic stars, you think you would be able to get one laugh out of them, but sadly not. Pete Holmes and Ellie Kemper deserve better than this. The film is decently filmed, hardly feeling stale or fake like the forced Christmas atmosphere of the last two flicks, but despite the snowy setting and some decent shots- there is little to be joyful about in this miserable adaptation. The script and story is down right diabolical at times, hurtful, and just sad to watch. Not to mention lead child actor Archie Yates is justb a total brat and honestly makes me wonder who the hell we were supposed to root for throughout this film. In the end, Home Sweet Home Alone takes the franchise up a very slight notch, but it is obviously no where close to as good as the first 2 films, or even the third. Its forced sense of humor and misuse of talent should be a learning point for many Hollywood films here on- simply on how to not make a star-studded comedy. It's about as disappointing as they come, and as forgettable and frustrating as a film can possibly be.

My Rating: 1.5/10.

review_title: An unnecessary remake that isn't as good as the original
review_detailed_main:
"Home Sweet Home Alone" isn't just the one of the worst titles in the series, it's one of the worst films in the series

Let me start off with the good. There is some decent comedy sprinkled here and there. Archie Yates give's a good enough performance, but doesn't come close to being as good as Macaulay Culkin. The two burglars are also kinda funny, and I liked how you kinda sympathize with them.

Aside from that though this a very dull movie that features boring characters, and weird pacing. This movie steals many things from the original, but never does anything with them. Also the kid in the movie while not badly portrayed is very unlikable. He isn't given enough character to make him interesting, and he's kinda the villain of the movie. Everything here feels like a carbon copy of the original. Also the trap sequence is very unsatisfying. They feel mean considering that we kinda sympathize with these people. Besides the trap sequence is like 15 minutes. That's it. It takes an hour for the movie to finally start, but then we get kinda boring traps. And finally this movie basically isn't even a sequel. The only reason is cause Buzz from the original makes one cameo, but honestly he doesn't even need to be there. He's in the move for like 3 minutes.

Overall "Home Sweet Home Alone" isn't the worst of the series, but it's definitely one of the most dull. It has slow pacing, dull characters, strange story decisions, and just a lack of true joy that it was just really bad.

review_title: Stop trying to compare it to the originals.
review_detailed_main: This was actually a surprisingly cute movie. They managed to modernize it whole keeping the spirit of the originals. They did a great job trying to make.it unique and original. Definitely worth the watch.

review_title: The Same Universe as Kevin McCallister's Home Alone
review_detailed_main:
This film is literally a spin off to the original Home Alone, and not a reboot.

Kevin's Brother plays a role in this film, and there's plenty of homage paid to the original 2 films, and even Home Alone 3. And that alone is worth to watch.

The plot is interesting, because the "wet bandits" of this film aren't really criminals, and actually quite the protagonist.

There will be plenty of negative reviews due to their stubborn mind that nothing else will beat the original film, even the film admits. But still this is an enjoyable Christmas family movie to watch, with its own memorable moments.
This ruined everything that made the original Home Alone A Classic this was just flat out awful in every since of the word stay away from one. Boring.

The rating on here is only low because people love the original Home Alone, so they will just review bomb it. That being said, this wasn't a good film.

It had a straight to dvd quality about it apart from the cast. It just felt cheep. Even though I'm sure it wasn't.

The story for me was also a mess. It doesn't give you a clear hero and villain which can be good but I don't know if that was the writer's intention. It's just like muddy. The main kid is an absolute brat. I would have left him home alone. And the "Villains" are decent people.

The type of story telling that I hate the most is "whoops! It was all a big misunderstanding" because when it's over you feel like you just wasted your time. If people had made "human" decisions to begin with the film wouldn't have had to happen so it seems like it was all for nothing. It's like full of air. Which it's a kids movie so I can't complain too much.

The ending is really sickly sweet which isn't my thing. I know that makes me sound harsh but I just don't love it when an ending is too saccharine. And like I said, the ending feels like you wasted an hour and a half because the issue could have been resolved in like 10 minutes.

The acting is fine and there was thought put into the script. I could feel Mikey Day in the script, if that's a good thing I don't know. But I could definitely hear him in it.

It's probably fine for kids, they might laugh when people fart in it? But no you can skip it.

The original Home Alone from 1990 and Home Alone 2 from 1992 are perfectly fine and entertaining films, they also have clever traps and likable or relatable characters.

But Home Alone 3, Home Alone 4: Taking Back the House, and Home Alone 5: The Hoiday Heist was just too much for the series. All they did was have different actors and bad acting with the traps not making sense.

So now we have the 6th movie in the Home Alone series called Home Sweet Home Alone (Home Alone 6), and I thought it was...

I thought this movie wasn't that good, which is weird when it has good actors and at least it has some good scenes but that was overthrown by bad moments.

The movie is mostly focused on the couple that is trying to steal back a valuable heirloom thinking the main kid stole it from them, but the more you focus on them the more you feel bad for them because of the problems in their life.

The main kid who is home alone and setting up the traps in the house is played by a good actor, but they make the kid really unlikable when he is hurting the couple with the traps even though they aren't that bad.

The traps are creative and interesting, but when the couple are being hurt and effected by them you just feel bad for them and it makes it hard to watch seeing them in pain.

They made the robbers played by good actors seem like the good guys and the main kid as the bad guy, I don't understand why they did that.

Other than there being some references to the original I didn't really find it funny or that much entertaining. Just watch the first 2 Home Alone movies, they are worth watching.

review_title: Rich, spoilt kid "STEALS" from the working class
review_detailed_main:
The new plot is a spoilt and wealthy kid who STEALS an expensive artifact and won't give it back. The owners of the artifact are in financial ruin and having to sell up their home to keep their family going. All they want is their doll back, but again the wealthy and well armed rich kid wins over the working class.

You can't get behind anyone. The biggest issue is that there is no villain. And arguably if you chose one it would be the boy, not the burglars.

You don't like the boy. You don't root for him. At all. He's not likable or motivated by anything other than further greed and selfishness.

There is no magic around being home alone. The point of "I made my family disappear" that sentiment of the original that Kevin learns the values of what his family love and connection is and his defending of it, the same as the mom wanting to get home realising she's put work and life ahead of family is also lost here.

review_title: Plot is horrible and the kid is like a villain
review_detailed_main: Part of the fun of the original Home Alone was the kind of innocence of a child vs criminals. Let me just say that the kid in this is a total brat. Instead of criminals, he is attacking people down on their luck. The end does not turn this around. It's a train wreck and you end up feeling like you watched a tragedy where no one wins. It will not give you the feeling of Christmas cheer. Will never watch again. My kids even said, man this is sick (not the cool kind of sick).

I wanted to watch this just to see if it is has bad as critics say, turns out they where right. I liked Home Alone(1990) and Home Alone 2(1992) and Home Alone 3 was okay, but haven't seen the last two.

There are references to the first home alone, there put in there to say this is not a reboot, but the same universe. Now I gave the story credit for trying to be different, and not be a carbon copy of the first film, and. Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney play a good comedic team pretty well, has a couple trying to save there family home. But the kid Max played by Archie Yates, is just unbearable and unlike Kevin, no ways wants to root for him. But not Yates fault, just how he was written. Aisling Bea doesn't really give off much has Max's mother unlike Catherine O' Hara, seems like she is sleepwalking through this.

Jokes don't really hit, trap gags just become reminders that you've watch them in better movies, and Max's family are just there no other reason, unlike the first two. And it is not easy to capture the magic that was the first Home Alone(1990).

Some reviewers may be a little too harsh. It isn't great, but it isn't terrible either. People seem to forget that these movies are mostly geared towards children. Worth atleast one watch with the amount of easter eggs hidden throughout.

We saw a new one coming out, we never really watched the other ones, so we wanted to make it movie night with it. We got about 20 minutes into it when he said "mama, this home alone is no good, let's watch something else". When your 5 year old says that? You know it sucks. They need to let this franchise go. Only the first two were any good. Sorry, Devin Ratray, but this one is going to get fed to my tarantula...

Understand that this is not a remake of the original Home Alone. Buzz makes an appearance in this movie so it is obviously set during current times well after the events of the original Home Alone occurred. (You will even hear references to it which is funny in itself).

That being said, I laughed out loud many times watching this movie. The "bad guys" were hilarious and I wish the Uncle played a bigger part because he was funny too.

Who out there expects a brilliant 10 star Christmas film, ever?? This is just what is needed during the holidays and will likely go into the rotation for our yearly holiday movies.

review_title: It was a great watch and the gags had me rolling with laughter.

review_title: I had hopes , but was let down
review_detailed_main:
I watched Home Sweet Home Alone ( sigh... I'm just going to refer to it as the " Home Alone Reboot.") I had honestly thought this project could be good. The fact this was delayed for 2 years, I thought, maybe just maybe it could be good?

This is the type of movie, when the credits roll, you feel ashamed and embarrassed for viewing. I honestly wish there was SOMETHING positive for me too add, there isn't. You have a lot of good comic names, but sadly, they add nothing. The main child, I just hated. He was unlikable and had no charm like Culkin had.

There are no reason to actually like these character's, most of their back stories just don't finalize. What made the original " Home Alone" great was Catherine O' Hara, she showed a real genuine love to get home to her son. Yes, this had the same cookie cutter plot, without believing that mother really wants to get to Chicago.

Home Alone, original, was not a ' great" movie by any standard, but it is iconic. This reboot feels like a direct to Redbox film or a hotel " exclusive" film.

My final thought, pass. Watch Jungle Cruise again instead.

Turned it off after 20 minutes. Terrible attempt at comedy. Main character kid is as unlikable a character as you can get. Without doubt worst installment in the series. No wonder it's free on Disney plus.

review_title: It Was a Mess. Not Joking, It has ZERO Jokes!

I am not exaggerating, it was not funny. The bad guys weren't bad, because they had reasons. Not joking.

It was low budget and it showed. They tried to do the original gags, but due to Liberalism, they can't. We are all equal, and boys and girls act the same.

Remember when Kevin acted like a kid, made fun of Buzz;s girlfriend...you know being a boy.. That doesn't exist in this movie...because we are all the same and we judging people on looks is bad...barf!!!

So it is truly a 1 out of 10. I gave it 2, because people will simply ignore and call me a hater or some other made up coping word for the truth.

Stop messing around with our childhood or our memories and let the classics stand on their own. Stop doing remakes or reboots that are pure trash like this. It's worthless even as a cashgrab. Awful. Felt sorry for the kid, though.

review_title: Not as great as the originals, but good.

review_title: Wow. Just.. Wow (and not in a good way)
review_detailed_main:
And here we go again. So-called "Home Alone 6", the franchise that keeps being added to for reasons that nobody can remember.

Released on so-called "Disney+ Day" as a Disney+ Original, Home Sweet Home Alone to give it its actual title does what it says on the tin - a boy is left home alone by accident (through parents having made a hash of planning/leaving/rounding everybody up and then not noticing for quite some time they're missing a body. Meanwhile said kid ends up having to to booby trap the whole establishment to inflict some pain on some intruders.

Regrettably if this is designed to entice people into Disney+ then you can probably be forgiven for thinking Disney+ is full of this sort of material, the rehashing of "classics" and the butchering of archive material. But that's for another day.

Archie Yates gets the mantel for the lead character in a Home Alone (titled) film (probably off the back of his appearance in JoJo Rabbit), and does a decent effort with the material he's been served, but realistically even if Macaulay Culkin was still ten years old today he'd struggle to do much with this as well. I dare say any child actor who was cast would create a miracle out of the script.

Unfortunately adding John Williams' Home Alone score and music cues doesn't make it a Home Alone movie, neither does sticking booby traps in a house, some bad guys and an insane amount of pain. No there has to be something else. This doesn't have it, and so it'll just be the latest in the line of dreary Home Alone wannabes without any concept of what made the first (and second) film work.

On the positive side, this is still better than the fourth film (which is hardly difficult), but it sits in my eyes quality wise between the fourth and fifth film. I believe I said in a previous review (for the fifth film) something along the lines of "this doesn't get anywhere near Home Alone 1 and 2 and I'll be surprised if any future additions to this franchise get anywhere near them". So I was right then :)

review_title: A predictable mess but nonetheless it finds surprising new ways to offend and fail

review_detailed_main:
I just watched Home Sweet Home Alone out of morbid curiosity. Home Sweet Home Alone isn't terrible but its really lame.

The acting is fine, I don't think anyone is bad. Archie Yates plays Max Mercer, he was in Jojo Rabbit which I haven't seen yet. Ellie Kemper and Rob Delanely play the robbers, they had small roles in The Lego Batman Movie and Deadpool 2.

Home Sweet Home Alone is similar but different to the original. The robbers are actually a nice married couple about to lose their house and they believe Max stole a priceless heirloom. They're actually the main characters instead of Max.

Home Sweet Home Alone has some callbacks to the original like the score and Buzz McCallister who was naturally shown in the trailer. Buzz is a cop rather than a criminal. Kevin is mentioned but he doesn't show up.

The humor is so lazy, maybe some of the jokes were adlibbed. I wasn't in pain, I never felt the urge to shut if off in fact I honestly wanted to know the ending. A line Max says in the ending honestly moved me.

Overall, Home Sweet Home Alone is really lame. We're all glad this movie is somewhat different but the filmmakers made the wrong choices. If you have kids, you could give it a shot.

The "villains'" are not really bad. They were taken advantage of by the boy and his mom and really are just trying to save there home and care for there family. And the left alone boy is not relatable or even a particularly good actor. I find him and his whole family annoying, selfish, and don't care about them as characters. Really not a good Disney movie. It made me so upset about the storyline and horrible premise I walked away in disgust.

review_title: Better than I thought it was going to be
review_detailed_main: Watched last night with my kids. I have to say it was better than I had expected. I really can't understand some of the other bizarre reviews on here and some of the personal comments about Archie Yates I find disturbing, also remember Home Alone has already had 4 sequels and 3 of them are worse than this installment. As a film I thought it was ok it was never going to be as good or better than the first two films but for what it was was fine and at the end of the day my kids enjoyed it and at the end of the day that's what it is a kids/family movie.

review_title: Piggy from Lord of the Flies returns and he's no push over

review_detailed_main: In 1990, a warm-hearted slapstick film called "Home Alone" was a surprise blockbuster hit, breaking the record for the highest-grossing live-action comedy, nominated for a Golden Globe, and followed by three sequels. This quasi-remake, "Home Sweet Home Alone," keeps the basic storyline about a child accidentally left behind who defends his home from would-be burglars with complicated contraptions. It even includes an actor from the original, and a child slapping his cheeks in astonishment, the original's iconic image. But it misses the key elements that made both the slapstick and the sentiment of the 1990 version appealing. Yates' nicely understated delivery is not used as effectively here as it was in "JoJo Rabbit." To get away from his extended family, Max goes to the garage and climbs into the back seat of the car to watch Road Runner cartoons (a clear inspiration for all of the "Home Alone" movies). Instead of the cartoonishly bumbling robbers of the original film, who made it easy to enjoy their downfall, the "home sweet home" is just as important to this film's intruders, a married couple played by the endlessly likeable Ellie Kemper (Pam) and Rob Delaney (Jeff). They are under a lot of financial stress because Jeff has lost his job as a data migration expert. The way he and Pam refer to "the cloud" as the reason he is out of work is probably the movie's best joke. Jeff's obnoxious show-off brother Hunter (Timothy Simons, underused) and his wife and son arrive to make Jeff feel even worse about not providing for his family. As ridiculous as it is for Pam and Jeff to try to break into Max's house to retrieve the doll, we want them to get it back so they can stay in their home. And as ridiculous as it is for Max to set up booby traps that would impress both Rube Goldberg and Navy Seals, we can understand that he feels vulnerable and is trying to do what he can to stay safe. The original film had a genuinely touching subplot of family reconciliation to add tenderness to the over-the-top pratfalls. This one only gestures feebly at the kind of cozy connections that made the conclusion of the earlier film comforting and even meaningful.

review_title: Coming from a 90s kid, loving the original two..
review_detailed_main: If you can look past how great the first two were, and completely forget about everything after, this adaptation wasn't THAT bad. I feel like everyone is giving bad reviews because they are comparing the first two. I can also agree that they prob shouldn't have made anything after the first two. But I enjoyed this with my 12 year old. I definitely had my reservations as most will or do. But as modern twist to the style of home alone film, I'd say give it more credit. The acting was actually decent and not some cheesy b movie acting level. The amount of well known actors/actresses that know how to act also helped carry the film. The jokes weren't insanely funny but I definitely chuckled more than I expected to. If you want a modern twist to an old favorite, give it a go and just remember nothing will come close to the originals.

review_title: Is it Actor Nick frost son?- "Worst remake since National lampoons"
review_detailed_main: Is this a horror movie? The casting is so bad, however the movie is far worse than the cast. The violence was far worse than original. How could you laugh when you were on the side of the house sellers. The plot was crazy and had racist slurs towards the English kid.

Not sure how this got green lit. This is a bad movie, the casting, the script, the plot, even the call backs to the first two movies couldn't have felt more forced. It's a bad as you'd think it would be. Time you'll never get back that couldn't be better spent literally doing anything else.

Home Sweet Home Alone is an awful reboot. A pointless, surprisingly convoluted, colossally stupid and weirdly morally broken film that never succeeds at being funny or heartwarming. Both the jokes and the slapstick are painfully unfunny with some of them going on for far too long. Archie Yates does what he can in the lead role but really isn't given much. Likewise, Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney almost make a few jokes land but they still can't elevate material that's this bad. At least it's mercifully short.

Really didn't enjoy but some people might like this, just not for me being such a fan of the classics.

Yes it's redundant and yes it's cliche at this point, but this movie is much funnier and funner than any of the movies in this series sunset part 2. 1/2 are head and shoulders better, but home sweet home alone has some genuinely hilarious moments and is a fun watch. I'm not an adult child so it doesn't bother me that it's a knock off of the original or whatever these babies are complaining about. The movie pokes fun at itself as well. review_title: Some things should not be made!

We don't need this many movies, stop wasting money on making shitty movies. The original Kevin McAllister made the movie way better,this new one just makes it seem like you are getting beat up by a rich kid who wants to watch cartoons in his parents bmw.

The kid literally committed a felony in the first 2 minutes of the film. The rest of the film is about a struggling couple just trying to get their heirloom worth 6-figures back. I mean seriously dude, stop eating so much candy and get a life.

What a joke, the creators of this should be ashamed... completely missed the point if the original. Some clever references to the original. But just terrible. I don't know where to begin with this... just don't watch it. Making an absolutely awful kid so glorified... what the hell were they thinking with this one.

review_title: This is a crap wrapped like the perfect gift for Christmas
review_detailed_main:
It's sad and pathetic how a movie that takes advantage of people's collective memory can't even do it in the dumbest and most simplistic way, it doesn't even try. Home sweet home alone (2021) remake of Home alone directed by chris columbus, (1990), is a movie that drops from the premise; "a spoiled little boy and only son of a single and not at all nice mom obsessed with work has to stop two moronic idiots who thought he had a valuable maggifin for the resolution of a conflict that nobody is interested in getting into their house". From the script, this movie is total crap, but more importantly, because it makes no sense, we shouldn't care so much about it, at least not enough to watch it once, and never see it again in the little or much time we have to live; being that both the original and the sequel are more than Christmas classics of all the times, you can see for miles what immediately makes it a clumsy insult, full of commercial brands and out-of-place jokes. Every character that appears here is either a poorly made copy of the original, or a malicious modern reinterpretation of it, but hiding under ideals of intent and insertion. What's worse, having a bad character who wants to give himself a better life than he has on his own merits, or a brainless person who tries to give free rein to his means just for a selfish situation that could have been solved in the right way more than easily, and even more having technological tools at hand?.... In short, it's mixing the first and the third movie, or rather making a pseudo remake of the third movie with elements of the first one so that the audience feels it was worth watching, which leaves down to the ground any desire to recommend it not only to a casual audience, but even to any child fan of the last seasons of south park or merry melodies. It assembles a bunch of comic actors with nothing to do, with a script written in a day and a half or two, along with all the technical luxuries that disney can offer to two sloppy directors whose success resides in writing for films that are not tied to a conventional plot and the result is absurd in a bad way, a mockery of the comedy of the original, a spit of red-green that thinks it is more imaginative and aggressive, but fails in so many ways, it is simply unbelievable that it has come out at all. This film makes everything that followed after 1992 look like a masterpiece. Undoubtedly a dreadful remake, which I thank all the saints it is on disney plus, and not disney channel or the like so my family or someone close to me can easily watch it.

2.5/10.

If anyone has seen the other home alone reboots you'd be expecting this one to be the same as them. A disgrace to have the name home alone and a pretty bad movie but this movie actually suprised me. Not sure why there are so many bad reviews, enjoy it for what it is. Grab a hot chocolate and have fun!

Is it a remake of Home Alone or a new version of SAW? If We speak about the traps that this kid did. Unbelievable! I'm sorry about Archie Yates, He is a talented young boy.

Look, this isn't Home Alone 2: Lost in New York (my favourite) or the original or even the unfairly-maligned Home Alone 3, but it isn't quite as terrible as some of the reviews I've read would suggest. Yes, the premise has been done before and better, and there's an English kid in Chicago and the quote-unquote bad guys are different to any of the franchise's bad guys before, but there are still some enjoyable scenes in this movie, including Kevin's brother Buzz in a cameo scene as a local police officer. Hearing the opening strains of 'Somewhere in my Memory' never fails to provoke Christmas nostalgia, too.

review_title: Total Garbage. Leave the Classics Alone Disney!

Growing up and watching the original with my family has always been a tradition and we were skeptical when it was announced. We watched the first trailer and we realized it's worse then we thought. Disney keeps taking original good movies and turning them into garbage. DISNEY LEAVE MOVIES AS THEY ARE.

review_title: Who decided this was a good idea?!?!

I wasted my time so you don't have to.

review_title: Would have given zero stars if I could...
A nostalgic glow in the shadow of giants
review_detailed_main:
I consider Maculay Culkin one of the greatest child actors ever, and his performances in home alone 1&2 made him an international treasure. I watch both of the originals every year, and I knew that Home sweet home alone wouldn't get close to the brilliance of the OGs. That being said, it wasn't terrible.

We do get to see Buzz again, and along with all the callbacks, that made it all worth it to me. The charm, humour and wit of the first movies are lacking, and I didn't laugh more than a couple of times throughout the entire movie, but the nostalgic music, traps and callbacks made me smile throughout.

Give it a chance. If you love HA 1&2 I think it'll be worth your time, just don't excpect anything close to the classics.

review_title: A movie you'll want to forget

Real feel good movie. Really enjoyed it and there was a good few very funny bits. My 6 and 8 year old love it. Not a remake so people need to relax and just enjoy!

This was actually a great home alone movie I can't believe how a lot of people rated this poorly. I haven't seen a good movie like this in years. This movie really deserves better credit than what it got from people who rated this movie. I would like to think the directors and the people who made this movie because again it was really amazing to watch.
Looks awful, bad copy of the classic original. Awful actors, and the acting looks awful .Really shouldn't of bothered. Stop remaking films. .........................................................

review_title: Love it for what it is.
review_detailed_main:
Critics and Debbie downers will poo poo this one for its attempt at re-capturing a classic. However, my family and I truly enjoyed it. Wifey and I are diehard fans of HA1 and HA2.

Seeing the cast and crew on this one gave me some hope that it would be worth the watch. I appreciated the respect to the HA universe and not trying to just cash in on the branding with cheap slapstick laughs like some of the newer sequels.

The storyline was well done, breaking from the classic in a creative way, while also calling back from time to time. Its modern day nuances will give your kids a more relatable story and the belly laughs from the traps will be plenty.

Give it a chance, it's fun. It's not the OG, but that's okay. It will still find its way into my kids' holiday rotation.

review_title: Fun for fans of the original 2

Some very funny antics in this movie. What would made this movie better is if Daniel Stern, Joe Pesci and Macaulay Culkin could have been in this film. That would have brought the stars up for this movie. I've always thought to do a Home Alone sequel justice, why not do one that Kevin Mccallister accidentally leaves his kid at home and the sticky bandits fresh out of prison show up to the house it all started now owned by Kevin. This time getting punishment dished out by Kevin's son. Like father like son. Back to this film, I as a mega fan of the original two movies, found this to be a fun watch and enjoyed the nostalgia that was in it.

review_title: THE WORST MOVIE I HAVE SEEN THIS YEAR!!!!!

review_title: A Home Alone that Fails to Understand its Premise
review_detailed_main:
Home Sweet Home Alone is a complete disaster. The trailer didn't look all that great, but I was hoping for at least a fun holiday movie. Oh boy, this movie is even worse than you can possibly imagine. It's one of the worst movies I've watched all year.

The original Home Alone works because it's this great adventure-like story of a kid being left home alone and the sort of things he gets into. Then he encounters these burglars who are bad people and want to break in to rob his house. He then takes measures to protect it and because these burglars are bad people we enjoy watching them fall into the traps and get hurt. Not only that, but it's a great movie about family trying to be together for Christmas. It's filled with great themes and has a great heart.

Home Sweet Home Alone forgets all of this and makes a completely joyless movie that doesn't work at all.

Instead of the movie focusing on Max Mercer being "home alone" the movie instead focuses mainly on the two "burglar" characters. They are the ones we follow. They are the ones we care about. The movie isn't about the kid being home alone, it's about these two burglar characters being in bad place in life and making a poor decision. However, because of the way the movie portrays everything, we're not really rooting against the burglars! We almost agree with what they're doing. The movie is basically propelled forward because of a misunderstanding. So when the "burglars" are getting hurt and caught in the trap it's not really enjoyable at all. We're not rooting for the kid. We're almost rooting against him and thats not what you want from a Home Alone movie!

There's no adventure for a kid being left home alone. We get a two minute montage of him playing in the house and eating junk food...but thats it! There's no scenes. Of him going shopping, decorating the house, doing adult chores. Thats some of the charm of the original. Watching a kid be responsible. Here we get nothing. We don't follow the kid at all! He's a supporting character. Why call the movie Home Sweet HOME ALONE if you're not evem following the kid who is HOME ALONE?

We don't even get to know the family at all. We get maybe two to three scenes of the mom trying to get back and that's it. There's no scene of regret from the mom, no character growth for the mom. There's just no characters at all in the family. They're just people that are there.

Archie Yates is good in the movie. I think he's a talented child actor. He was fantastic in Jojo Rabbit, but unfortunately he's given nothing to work with here. Elle Kemper is good, as is Rob Delaney, but again their talent is wasted in this abysmal movie.

The best part of this movie is the cameo from Buzz McCallister. He has a great scene in the movie that actually made me laugh. It was a clever scene and one that I rewound to watch again because of how good it was.

Overall. This movie is a complete disaster. Watch the original two. Don't waste your time with this. I watched it so you don't have to.

review_title: This is too much copy of home alone
review_detailed_main: Really disappointed after watching the movie. Story is nothing special same as home alone the movie name also has home alone at the end. Anyways for copying like that a 1 star rating from my side. We like to see new and creative movie not just some copy and recreate.

Did Home Alone 4 not teach you anything? Nostalgia =/= Reboot. We love the old and hate to see them ruined by greed. It's 2021 - be creative. Give current generations something to feel nostalgic about 20 years from now.

This movie is absolutely stupid. The plot is absurd. Not to mention the implication that boys dressing like girls is ok. About the only thing they did well was the music from the original movie. It was nice to see Buzz, but it would've been nice to see some other original cast members.

In the first home alones you cheered on the kid because the bad dudes were well...bad. In this story it's a huge misunderstanding between two parties of good people. The adults get the short end of the misunderstanding and endure literal torture. Even my 6 and 8 year old were cringing and didn't think it was funny. Just awful and graphic for a family movie.

Is this movie perfect? No. Is it on par with the original? No. But does it have charm and things to commend? Yes, I say so. While "Home Sweet Home Alone" does follow in the same footsteps of the originals in places, it does offer some new ideas to the story that I can respect. You can feel why Max wants to be left alone, and he's not a brat about it like Kevin in the original. The burglars have a good reason and story for why they want to break into his house, the end has a clever twist and expectation subversion that I fully respect. And the end was really sweet and heartwarming.

Add in some nods to the originals and other movies and you have a solidly fine yet familiar "Home Alone".

Child of the 80's here. I watched the original when it was a new release and loved it from childhood to present at a "christmas favorite" movie. I thought this particular movie was only a VERY slight nod to the original(kid is alone, adults get beat up lol) i enjoyed the quirky plot and chara ters and think its 100% worth a watch.

This film definitely better than these reviews are giving it I honestly don't know what they expect from a family Christmas film.

There is no way it was going to top 1 or 2 but it fits in well with the Christmas films and is about 3rd best of the series.

If people want to criticise I suggest the inflict the 4th film on themselves as it's a disaster.

It's a Christmas film and worth a watch even if it's just something different to watch with the kids.

It's Christmas it's time for over the top kids films and this does it.

We really enjoyed this film and will be watching it for years to come at Christmas time.

review_title: Made deck the halls look like citizen Kane.
review_detailed_main:
There was one good part. The end credits.

Bad Christmas movies are my guilty pleasure, but the "so bad it's good" type. This is not this type. I won't watch this again.

Some of the slapstick was mildly funny, but doesn't warrant a repeat viewing.all in all the biggest problem was the meandering, confusing plot. All the characters are very dislikable. You actually HOPE the child spends christmas alone because he's a nasty, annoying little psychopath.

They don't introduce the characters properly or slow the action to get an emotional connection.

Not even a cameo from buzz mccallister in the original movie saved it in any capacity. It just reminded us to go straight over to watch the original ... Avoid!

I like the two original Home Alone movies. While certainly not the best films out there, they have a heart and good humor. This newest entry however, has nothing. No heart, no soul, no humor - i kid you not, not one single joke lands. This film has no reason to exist but to grab some money on a still good name. Like the third one did. However, that name is now seriously tarnished by a 50% stinker rate.

Bad.

Terrible child actor and they had to make it all woke and couldn't have villains who were just bad.

Doubt anyone will be watching this by next Christmas.

Everything about this movie sucks. The kid, the traps, the characters, the "burglars." First of all, the kid here is extremely punch-able, he's way too overpowered, has way too many high tech items to beat up the villains, and is a horrible person overall. What's his motive though? The married couple is trying to take a valuable doll that the kid "stole." Yeah, not very good.

The humor is also extremely bad. It's awkwardly unfunny and stupid. This entire script felt like it was written by a guy who had to ask his kids what slang words are popular, and what a "Fortnite" is. There is a joke at the beginning of a movie where the family is watching an 'Angels with filthy souls' remake. (The fake movie in the original Home Alone with Johnny and Snakes) The dad then says "Why do they remake the classics, they're never as good as the original." Haha. Good one Disney. Meta does not equal funny.

The traps as well are absolutely awful. It's just slapstick repeats of the original ones but modernized to cause more carnage. The kid puts a VR headset onto one of the burglars, and makes it look like he's in more danger than he really is.

Finally, this movie just doesn't work. What makes the original Home Alone movies so good, is that they came out just before cell phones became a thing. If this scenario were to happen in real life, it would be solved instantly. Overall, this is just a garbage movie made by Disney to rake in the most amount of money by trying as little as possible, and pandering to the fans of the originals. Buzz is in this as a cop and is absolutely insufferable. He's a dumb failure of a cop that is only here to connect both movies and talk about Kevin in one scene.

Wouldn't recommend this to anyone unless you're a fan of bad movies. 1/10 would give 0 if I could.

review_title: Why beat the wrong guys ?? They are not thieves
review_detailed_main:
Movie failed to do justice. Beating the poor guys . Why ??

They are just trying to save their house

First movie was very well made.

This is a failed attempt.

Should have been better.

If you don't compare it's a decent movie to watch with your family. Yes the original is the best and we grew up watching that but appreciate this film to recall those memories

So stop comparing and happy Christmas 2021.

I watched this movie when it first started streaming on Disney+ at Christmas two years ago. And that was enough for me! This is without a doubt the worst movie in the Home Alone franchise! The first two are classics, the 3rd one is okay, and the 4th and 5th are at best, only mildly funny (though the former really does the first two dirty). But this one? This thing is abominable.

First of all, the story is ridiculous. It focuses on Jeff McKenzie (played by Rob Delaney) and his wife Pam (Ellie Kemper), who live in Chicago with their two kids, and are on the verge of losing their house, because Jeff is out of a job. As soon as they find out that a malformed doll that they own is worth a lot of money, they plan to sell it on eBay, but find it missing. They end up suspecting that a British (for whatever reason) 12-year-old boy named Max Mercer (Archie Yates), who stopped at their home with his mother during an open house to use the restroom, stole it. Meanwhile, Max has accidentally been left home alone by his family (sound familiar?), who's going to Tokyo, because he fell asleep while hiding out in the car, watching cartoons. So, what do Jeff and Pam do? They plan to break into Max's house to steal the doll back, without talking to Max about it. Max misinterprets it as a planned kidnapping, so he booby-traps his house just for them. Yeah. That is the stupidest conflict I've ever heard of.

In regards to the characters: Max, our so-called "hero", is wholly obnoxious. He has none of the character depth or charm of our TRUE hero, Kevin McCallister, from the first two movies. He's just an incredibly one-dimensional little brat, and early on, all we see of him is him complaining to his mom for not getting him McDonald's, whining that he hates his family, with no explanation as to why. Remember the pizza scene in the original movie? That was where we learned why we were expected to root for Kevin; he felt like his family mistreated him. Here, there's no such scene. We ALSO get no scene of Max going through anything that makes him come to realize he wants his family back, and instead, he's overjoyed over having the house to himself, before suddenly wanting them back out of nowhere, just a few minutes later. There's no build-up or development to his realization, the way we saw Kevin, after the initial joy over being alone, develop and mature so much over the course of the first movie, and come to realize how much he took his family for granted. Instead, more screentime is devoted to Jeff and Pam, and it ends up making THEM easier to root for. And because of that, the physical pain that Max inflicts on them is actually not funny at all. What made the pain that Kevin inflicted on Harry and Marv hilarious in the first two movies was that they were actually burglars who DERSERVED it, and the same can be said for the 3rd, 4th and 5th movies. Here, the so-called "burglars" are actually completely innocent, though very stupid people, with sympathetic motivations, so the slapstick that Max puts them through is just mean-spirited.

*spoiler*Even worse, it ends up being all for nothing, because the REAL thief was Jeff and Pam's nephew. And then, when he gives the doll back, he's praised for "saving the day", and Jeff and Pam forgive Max after clearing up the misunderstanding! WHAT?!!!?*end spoiler*

Also, the special effects: remember the amazing practical effects from the first couple movies? Well, this movie throws that out in favor of horrible CGI effects, even for 2021's standards, ESPECIALLY compared to the amazing CGI in all the movies by Marvel Studios! Have people forgotten how to animate CGI effects over the years?!

The acting is atrocious, ESPECIALLY by Archie Yates as Max! He shows none of the talent that Macaulay Culkin showed as Kevin. Even Rob Delaney and Ellie Kemper don't seem to care at all about their roles. It seems like nobody was trying at all. By the way, this movie contains a cameo by Devin Ratray, who reprises his role as Kevin's bullying older brother, Buzz, from the first two movies (so this movie wisely ignores the 4th movie), now grown up to be a police officer. Unfortunately, though he does mention Kevin and the events of the first two movies, even he can't save this!

And of course, there's the music. John Debney's score is so lame, and in fact, I don't even remember how any of the cues go! Especially compared to John Williams's amazing score from the first two movies. Not to mention, there's a blasphemous misuse of "Somewhere in my Memory", that gorgeous song from the first movie. It's awful.

So, everything considered, Home Alone 6 is one of the worst movies ever made, and is easily rock-bottom for the Home Alone franchise. With an idiotic and completely unoriginal story, incompetent writing, utterly botched characterizations, and completely sadistic, unfunny humor, this abomination does this wonderful franchise dirty, and John Hughes would roll over in his grave if he saw it. If you see this movie listed on Disney+, don't be tempted. Stop at Home Alone 2, or if you're a big fan, 3, 4, and/or 5 might be worth a viewing, but NEVER this one! Avoid at all costs!

This word kept coming into my head the whole way through. I knew it wouldn't be as good as the original 2 but this was an atrocity. Unlikeable characters, ridiculous story. I'm not saying it has to be believable but it's utter dross.

As a huge fan of Home Alone 1&2, this production has been a little bit of a rollercoaster for me. I was initially excited when I heard they were reviving the franchise, then I was disappointed when I found out Macaulay wasn't involved. I was still excited to see it, but about 10 minutes in, I realized that this was going to be a terrible movie. First off, I don't know if Archie Yates had to beat out a bunch of kids for the role, or if he was their first choice, but he was one of the most unlikable protagonists that I've ever seen. He had zero charisma and his personality made me root against him the entire movie. I don't who the "good guy" is supposed to be in this movie. The McKenzies are too nice to be villains, but too dumb to be heroes. Regardless, when they are subjected to the booby traps, the slapstick is more sad than funny. You don't want the obnoxious brat to win, so you just want all the "hijinks" to be over as soon as possible. Unfortunately this movie will probably put an end to the Home Alone franchise.

review_title: Leave your brain at the door and just enjoy!
review_detailed_main:
So is this the best Christmas movie ever, a worth remake of the original, finally the one that we can say "wow that was so much better than the original!"... Heck No, but why worry.

It's a fun Christmas movie for the family to watch, with some scenes that make you chuckle out loud and others that will make you smile. That's what I was looking for and that's what I got.

Old characters from the original making an appearance was good to see, but only adults could make that link. Younger kids wouldn't have a clue and why should they care. It's nostalgia for the old folks watching, a reminder of when we were young and felt exhilarated by booby traps and getting one over on the bad guys. Just like the young kids today will feel watching this movie, which is set in their modern world with things to which they can relate.

I love the original, it's one of the best Christmas movies for kids. I also like this one, not as much, but take it for what it is, remember what it's like to be a kid and just enjoy.

I honestly tried to watch the entire movie, but I only made through to about 20 minutes in before deciding the movie was entirely too cringe-worthy to give any more time to.

Also, in this one, the kid who is "protecting" his home is essentially the criminal...

I love Asling Bea but I'm sorry to see her in such a terrible movie. I would still say give it a watch and see if you like it, but honestly it's full of tired references and ultimately leaves me feeling like it was time and money wasted. Don't waste yours.

I really enjoyed this movie,the comedy and spoofs from Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney had me laughing until my stomach ached. The movie starts off with you uncertain of what to expect but as soon as you recognize the plot, that's when things really pick up. I stumbled on this movie by chance and never had heard of it with this title, however I will definitely be posting about it on my social media accounts. Great job to the producers, director and actors. This movie really made my night! I read some other reviews where some gave the movie low ratings, however this movie is really funny if you're looking for a good laugh!
After reading some reviews on here, we wasn't expecting much but really enjoyed, it is a general story yes.. but enjoyable story line.another good Christmas watch.
Why? It's like if you ordered the original movie on wish and some gnarly "not like the picture" version shows up. Don't waste your time. Just YouTube nut shot videos and you'll get more laughs.

review_title: Another bad remake. Nothing to see here. Move along now folks.

Wow , I didn't see such a bad movie with such bad actors in a long time. Boring , the story is scrambled , terrible in all way possible. Just waste of time.

review_title: Watch the original again before wasting a minute on this
review_detailed_main:
What were they thinking. Everything that was great about the original this has none of. So tragic just watch the original or watch diary of a wimpy kid originals if you want a bone Christmas familiar movie.

Things good about the original 1, great cute kid Lead who was also an excellent actor 2, awesome bad guys (amazing actors) 3, old guy next door story was excellent 4, supporting cast of John candy, Catherine O hara, John Heard 5, Great music 6, simple but fun story.

review_title: Nowhere near as bad as the reviews would suggest!
review_detailed_main:
Don't believe the terrible reviews. This is a fun family Christmas movie, as simple as that! And I say this as a HUGE fan of the originals. Home Alone 1 and 2 are a couple of my favourite films of all time, let alone just Christmas ones. Is this an absolute classic, like those first 2? Of course not, but that doesn't make it a 3.6.

Yes, you may find the kid kind of annoying, and it's cheesy, but that's what you expect from a Christmas movie! This delivers plenty of laughs, the traps are clever and interesting, there's a decent twist, and the acting is mostly good, too. Including cameos from Butch from those beloved originals, and Kenan Thompson from Kenan and Kel!

I genuinely believe people are only giving this film such negative reviews because they're directly comparing it to the classic originals. That is a shame, but it's also kind of on Disney by naming it as they did. If a few details were changed and the film had a different name, I genuinely believe the reviews would have been much better!

Try not to be a cynic, switch off your brain off for 96 minutes and give this a go. You never know; you might even enjoy it. I know I did!

review_title: Max is the worst main protagonist in the home alone era

review_detailed_main: Why reshoot movies or cartoons that already have a high rating, a lot of fans. As a rule, these are always unsuccessful options. Alone at home with Macaulay is a film of Christmas, New Year, pleasant memories. The new version of the film is a reminder that the current cinema has outlived itself.

Even though like most I couldn't understand why they were remaking such a classic movie. I did have high hopes for some of the cast, mainly Rob Delaney, Aisling Bea and Ellie Kemper who have been excellent in other productions.

Sadly this movie was so badly written and directed I had trouble watching it all the way through. Although the main part was well acted by Archie Yates, he had nowhere near the charm as the original, and was in some parts just unlikeable (obviously not his fault, no one could top Macauley anyway).

If just a tiny bit of though had been put into the script or story this could have bee heaps better. Also changing Harry and Marv from ruthless crooks to a couple (albeit cartoonish and stupid) just down on their luck, was the worst part of the movie for me

Please Disney stop doing these obvious cash grabs, just because you can, doesn't mean you should.

This movie was a atrocious failure. From choice and actors to the storyline from beginning to end. Disney should fire whoever okayed this movie. Someone was either trying to destroy Disney or the legacy of home alone created by Macaulay Culkin which was a brilliant first and second movie. You did not need to remake classics unless you found someone in this day and age just as good as a Macauley Culkin. You didn't you failed Disney stop failing your fans it is not about what you want it's about what the people want. You're going to end up like blackberry!

review_title: I think children's entertainment has peaked. This is how bad this movie is.
review_detailed_main:
The Good: This movie literally has me wondering if good writing and sensible filmic decisions have gone out the window. It seems like the idea of a "timeless" children's classic is getting further and further away from us. Aside from Frozen, I really can't think of another children's film that has stood the test of time, and that includes Pixar films. This movie at least prompted a reflection of the sad state of mainstream Hollywood filmmaking, I guess.

Ellie Kemper is also too charismatic not to be funny.

The Bad: You can generally tell how bad or good a film is by how much twisting the writers do to make the plot work and how consistent the characters act. If that's the standard to apply...this movie might be the worst of the year.

We begin with Max, a precocious, annoying, whiny, selfish little brat, who we're expected to root for. He can't bare the wait getting to his McMansion to use the washroom, so forces his mother to stop at a random open house. He uses the washroom and proceeds to insult the homeowner, a man named Jeff (played by Ron Delaney) about an antique doll collection he owns. Understandably offended by this little twerp, he drinks a soft drink in front of him without offering. We are led to believe Max steals one of the dolls in retaliation.

We come to learn that Jeff and his wife, played by Ellie Kemper, are in serious financial distress and are being pressured to sell their home. They have two children, who understandably don't want to leave their home. When Jeff discovers that the doll in his closet is worth $200K and that it is likely that Max stole it, he and Ellie (I'm really not going to remember the her character's name) embark to retrieve it. You know, his OWN property stolen by this kid.

HSHA flips the script, whether intentionally or not, to make the bandits more sympathetic than the rich, annoying British kid. We see as he torments these people with traps that feel like kid versions of Saw traps. Quite bizarre. As such, this movie isn't as much "fun," as it is a frustrating exercise to get through. The problem is so unbelievably easy to solve, yet we see two grown adults engage in the dumbest behaviour possible for absolutely no reason. This by itself, makes this movie absolute garbage.

But on top of that, the movie looks TERRIBLE. Remember the warmth cinematic quality of the original? This one looks like a TV show. Remember the fantastic score? This one sounds like the dollar store version. Remember the funny jokes and sensible characters? Nope. Let's have Ally Wong play annoying stepmom and people fart on each other. Great.

The Ugly: The audacity of this film is that it tries to shoehorn in a happy ending, one that comes out of absolutely nowhere. The Home Alone theme swells and you may briefly feel something. Don't be fooled. This movie sucks.
This is not a remake, it's a wholesome, fun movie. May not go down as an all-time classic, but my kids rolled with laughter, and that's all that matters.

I didn't have any hope for this movie but my husband put it on. It was better than expected and we enjoyed it. My son loves it and is now had it on repeat cor the last few days. So. We don't enjoy it as much anymore lol.

This film was a bit of a struggle, it seemed desperate to fill itself full of subliminal messages and values at the expense of a decent story.

By the time the battle plan takes form.. I really didn't care! Which was a shame because there were some great people in the cast, the ending is quite sweet but all the same I'd look elsewhere when choosing a film over the holidays.

Stop ruining my child hood

What's wrong with Disney Cinderella, Snow white and Now Home Alone it's been 20 years Just stop being WB.

It's enough to see a old story that getting worse every time.

I knew it wouldn't be as good as the original, it is after all a remake of a classic film which is still as popular and enjoyable today as it was upon release, but even I expected a tiny bit more.

In an attempt to differentiate itself from the original, the main child character is a bratty kid that steals a valuable antique doll, and two adults try to get it back. Immediately that makes it lack the same appeal as the original, which was a kid fighting back against robbers trying to steal his family's possessions.

Everything about it feels forced. Whereas the original was a "normal" family film with genuinely funny and charming characters and moments, this one feels like it's desperately trying to be funny, and it just doesn't work.

There wasn't a single bit of genuinely funny, nor fun, moments. I guess some children might enjoy the fart jokes and silliness, but that isn't what makes the original Home Alone so enjoyable; it didn't have to rely on cheap gimmicks or jokes. While the original was silly in places, it was on a solid base of a strong story and characters, and it wasn't trying to force laughs.

As Chris Columbus, the director of the original, said so accurately "it's a waste of time as far as I'm concerned. What's the point? I'm a firm believer that you don't remake films that have had the longevity of Home Alone. You're not going to create lightning in a bottle again. It's just not going to happen. So why do it? It's like doing a paint-by-numbers version of a Disney animated film - a live-action version of that. What's the point? It's been done. Do your own thing. Even if you fail miserably, at least you have come up with something original."

review_title: If there's anything redeeming, I must have missed it.
review_detailed_main:
Ah yes, the film that begs the question "what if they made another unnecessary Home Alone movie but completely failed to understand what made the first two films good?". Let's make the kid the most unlikeable character and let's have the audience sympathize with the home intruders! It's almost like this is the 4th one of these in a row that absolutely didn't need to be made.

My only hope is that the adults who knew better but made the movie anyway (both cast and crew) get the blame for how terrible this is. We as a people are not historically kind to child actors but we know two things about Archie Yates: he was brilliant in JoJo Rabbit so he CAN act, and it isn't his fault that the screenplay is just utter trash. Hopefully this will in no way hurt his future acting career.

3 was ok, 4 stank & this is just corporate greed.. genuinely don't waste your time!

Try hard, gimmicky & not much depth.

Just because Home Alone has become a Christmas classic isn't a reason to make another & another & another...

I don't get all the hate. I started to watch the film expecting nothing much, but I was pleasantly surprised. The film is a good attempt on a classic story. There were plenty of funny bits, original jokes and references to the originals to make it interesting. I give it a thumbs up.

Worst home alone movie ever. Even star cast was below average. It's a total waste of time. Very little attention paid on character building and plot was nonsensical. 90 s home alone movies were much better.

review_title: Finally, a Worthy Addition to the Home Alone Franchise!!!
review_detailed_main:
Yes, I actually liked the movie. I'm giving it a high rating, so go ahead and be a troll and give me a thumbs down and tell me my review isn't helpful because yall don't agree with me.

When I saw the trailer, I did roll my eyes and didn't care much for the kid, but when I watched it, he grew on me a little bit. This new installment in the Home Alone series (We're up to the 6th one now) is a LOT better then the previous two films, but it's still not as good as the original. To me, this feels like the true 'Home Alone 3' because one of the original stars from the originals makes an appearance, and they use the classic John Williams theme music. I was intrigued by the story, and it managed to make me feel nostalgic, especially when they play 'Somewhere in my Memory' This time, we get to know the burglars, and come to care for them and why they're doing the robbing.

Meet Pam and Jeff McKenzie, a down-on-their-luck couple who have to sell their house because it's getting too expensive to live there. They haven't told their children yet. During an open house, they run into 10-year old Max Mercer and his mom, Carol. They're only there because Max needed to stop and use the bathroom. On the way out, Max notices an ugly doll with an upside-down face. Max and Jeff have words over it and they finally leave. That night, Jeff researches the doll and finds that it's extremely rare and worth a lot. The only problem is that the doll is now missing.

The next day, Max's family is on the way to the airport to Japan, and of course, Max gets left home alone. He reacts the same way Kevin McCallister did, then he gets bored and lonely. Pam and Jeff assume that Max took the doll, and track him to his house and try to get it back. Max unfortunately misunderstands their intentions and begins his battle plan to strike back against the burglars.

I honestly feel that this movie is worthy of the Home Alone name. It gave me nostalgic feels like the first two, it has the classic John Williams music and it gave me a few laughs. I wouldn't mind watching it again. There are other easter eggs and nods to the original classic, too. If you love the franchise, I would highly recommend HOME SWEET HOME ALONE!!!

review_title: Not what I thought it would be based on trailer
review_detailed_main: I gave it a 6/10, its an ok movie, has some good call backs to the original. Trailer made me think it was going to be something completely different and it ended up being better than I thought it would be.

review_title: Knows what it is. Not as good as original 1&2 BUT leagues above any other sequels.

review_title: John Hughes is turning in his grave
review_detailed_main:
What made the Home Alone and Home Alone 2 so good was the casting, the acting, the jokes, the heartfelt spirit, and, of course, the classic John Williams score. Home Sweet Home Alone was downright appallingly bad.

I thought the premise was in very poor taste. A family that is struggling financially believes their rare doll (the solution to their financial woes) to have been stolen by a rich brat. This poor husband and wife spend much of the movie getting punished by this annoying kid. I was cringing at how tone deaf this plot was. Let's laugh at poor people who have to go to crazy lengths just to keep their home. Meanwhile, the rich annoying kid has to sleep in a BMW?

The acting was horrible. I can't believe Ellie Kemper (Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt) did this movie. They should've given it a different name like Homeless for the Holidays to complete the tone deaf narrative. This film doesn't deserve the Home Alone title in its name.

Amazing movie! A family-friendly Christmas Home Alone retelling in a different way! Very warm and kid-friendly like the originals! Also has a lot of nostalgic references that still make it well-worth the watch:)

It was stupid, it was cheesy, it was too violent for kids, it didn't feature a proper "bad guy". But it was funny. I laughed, numerous times, and that's really all that matters for a slapstick comedy.

review_title: Garbage. One of the worst movies ever!

Disney can't resist pushing woke narratives on kids as well, as of course they have the boy dress up in dress during a montage and focus of the doll being called ugly. God forbid the kid just be a normal smarty boy. This bologna needs to stop. Glad I didn't pay watch this trash. I got an idea disney/hollyweird, write an original story. Clowns.

Disney, you took a great movie and ruined it.

Rhe original is a classic so i wasn't expecting much but i loved the actors, the story line. The why and how's this could happen in the year 2021.

review_title: An unnecessary sequel that tarnishes the legacy of the original!
review_detailed_main:
If only sequels were easy, right? Home Sweet Home Alone is a sequel of sorts to the classic Home Alone series. Why would one make a modern day adaptation of an all-time classic? Maybe to appeal to the current generation of kids and give them ideas on how to target intruders or just to mint money. Thank god this was an direct to OTT release because this would have bombed big time if it was not.

Set during Christmas, the Mercer family are on their way to Tokyo for the holidays. They leave a young sleepy kid, Max Mercer behind; all alone at home. Enter Jeff & Pam; parents who are struggling financially. They suspect that Max has stolen a prized doll from their open house and try to take it back by breaking and entering. And yes, Max's mom rushes back from Tokyo.

If you are adapting the movie for the current generation, make some significant changes at least. The major change we see here is the motivation of the intruders. They are not thieves. They just want what is theirs. This is a typical Disney move; everyone has a backstory; in this case a sob story. There is also the accent. Basically, mommy Mercer & Max Mercer are British. Yes, that makes a lot of difference!

Max Mercer is played by Archie Yates of Jojo Rabbit fame. He is a kid alright but it is quite difficult not to compare him to Macaulay Culkin. The two intruders are played by Ellie Kemper & Rob Delaney. Both usually have excellent comic timing. But the slapstic routine doesn't work for them. Nevertheless, it is always fun to watch them in action.

We also get a peek into what McCallister is doing now with Buzz McCallister's character making an appearance as a cop.

Home Sweet Home Alone is a failed attempt at recreating an all-time holiday classic for the current generation. The thing is; the original is an evergreen classic. It works for every generation. Disney, you are better than this!

review_title: Ignore the reviews - it's actually better than the original in a lot of ways
review_detailed_main:
I was expecting this to be absolutely terrible but it's actually really good. There's some quality actors including a few from Saturday Night Live, and the script is surprisingly clever.

The premise is not the same as the original and some parts were even funnier than the original. Definitely recommend it.

Yes, ofcourse the original movie is the best and nothing can beat it. There's even a scene in which this fact is argued. I like that there's a twist. The kid is annoying and the burglars aren't necessarily the bad guys. I even felt bad for them as they got beaten over and over again by falling for the booby traps. I watched this a day after watching the original, no expectations. I wasn't disappointed. It made me laugh, and in the end even the annoying kid became sympathetic. It's easy to burn down a movie because everyone else is and write a devastating review based on watching the first 10-20 minutes. Just give it a chance. I believe it's worth more stars than what it's currently rated.

review_title: As a Stand-alone movie it's okay
review_detailed_main:
Okay, so I'm not going to compare this to the original 1990 as it's just unfair as nothing will ever be able to replace or remake the original

As a stand-alone movie for the young generation that may have not seen the original (or even care about making comparisons) it's okay.

It has some very entertaining parts for kids to laugh at, unfortunately as an adult I didn't find myself laughing that much, in fact I was cringing more than anything at some of the acting and dialogue - not sure how the characters were cast - I imagine they were trying to distance the characters as much as possible from the original, which is where (in my opinion) failed. It's clear that they wanted to have this movie stand on its own yet brought in so many references to the original. Therefore for me it felt very very clunky in parts

I feel that they could have made this so much better but the casting and dialogue just didn't sit well with me.

I have to say they really tried. But failed miserably. The "bad guys" aren't bad guys at all and while the kids have fun with the booby traps, the parents can really empathize with the couple and few really bad for the way things are happening. And it's kinda impossible to find it funny. It could have been really really good... but it was, in my opinion another failed remake.

New Kid but the plot was different that ended well, they had a few good comedians on here and they brought back an old character from the 1st two movies which was cool to see. This whole movie was wacky because it really could have been one way but it spiraled into bizarre happenings which made it decent.

I understand that many have fond thoughts of the original. The movie even acknowledges this by one character saying that people shouldn't remake classics ... ah the irony. But I reckon they see themselves as a sequel/reimagination of some kind. One link being one of Kevins brothers, now all grown up. I reckon because they couldn't get McCaulkey himself ... neither of them actually, they went for someone else.

It is not his fault the movie is being so ill received. It has something to do that the villains here are being made human. Well simple minded, totally ridiculous ones, that are borderline kids when it comes to certain situations they find themselves in, but likeable ones because their quest is pure. Well it involves breaking and entering (no matter what the main character says about having the key and sometimes remembering the alarm code or not, conveniently I might add), so maybe not entirely pure, but you get the gist.

But if that is what breaks the movie for you - well you have quite the romantic view of the original. Kevin was not a good kid by any mean of that word. And he was just as vile if not even more - especially in the sequel. Yes he might have looked cuter than the "Kevin" of this movie (he has a different name, I forgot it, sorry), but he isn't. At all! Having said that, you may feel different and that is ok. If you do not like this - it is so. It is just a shame that a movie that is overall similar, in tone, jokes and traps, gets so much hate, when it isn't that different from the original. Or maybe that is what makes is unbearable for some - although again, it is not a Remake in many senses. Because of the backstory of the "villains". You decide what you make of it.

review_title: Movie misses the point of the franchise
A remake no one asked for!
review_detailed_main: The plot of the movie was exactly the same, just like the original movie. The storyline was kinda the same, but it wasn't very well written, it was kinda silly. The location of the movie was nice. But, the original house was way better. The characters weren't very interesting nor likeable. In my opinion, the remake wasn't really good.. Also, it wasn't funny, most jokes were very childish. The only intense and good part of the movie was, the final battle scene with the traps. The traps, were just like "Saw" traps, but they were family friendly, lol. The ending scene was unexpected, it was nice. Overall, it was an average movie. I have to admit that, this movie doesn't deserve so much hate. I mean, it's not that bad.. Last but not least, the acting was nice.

Overall, not completely terrible. Fans of the first two are always going to hate it, due to the uniqueness and story telling of them, at the time. Many reviews on here are probably from people who haven't actually watched it, and just want to complain. Is far better than the 3rd, 4th and 5th installments.

Aisling Bea was far under used, and Rob Delaney was a bit annoying. Randomly the dad of the main kid didn't really care his son was left at behind. That aside, there is an enjoyable film in there.

The lad in main role was actually good in the role, I know that people will hate him just because of the British accent.

There's fun along the way, the normal slapstick you expect. Younger people will certainly enjoy it, sit back and just enjoy it for what it is.

review_title: Comparison is the thief of joy.
review_detailed_main: We watch Home Alone 1 and 2 in the mini van year round. On repeat. They are our favorite movies, and nothing will ever compare to the originals. We laughed. We snuggled with our kids. I really wish people would be a little kinder with their opinions... especially around the holidays. To those involved in the making of this fun, cute movie, I say... thank you!! Happy season!
It's a movie for kids, and my kids loved it. It's not great, but it's very watchable. At least my kids didn't make me watch the third or fourth movies in the series.

Don't let your kids watch this. It's not funny in any way. Utter trash trying to cash in on the success of the '90's movies with Culkin.

It wasn't a remake or a remastered copy of Home Alone, it was -at most- a low budget parody cosplay with extremely bad taste. Nothing saves it.

This movie is so pointless, meaningless and nonsense.

No connection or context in the movie... worst of all 6 movies.

I do hope actors, even the main child will get to be on a better movie, Heck even a good disney movie.

The original had only american english, we all know how "funny" the english are. The kid is trying to hard to be part of it and to be honest is an obese kid which is not cute.

review_title: An ode to the original with a twist
