A lovely Christmas movie about family.

review_title: Underestimated the audience on this one, I think

If you haven't seen it, don't bother- just tell Aisling you did see it and she was great. Too bad she wasn't in it much.

Worst christmas film since diehard... and in the words of Bruce Willis ..its not a Christmas movie.

This film is sluggish from start to finish... poor casting... acting and budget.. it makes a mockery of the originals which are Christmas film (timeless) classics.

review_title: Glad I watched it, and the kids loved it
review_detailed_main:
I loved the originals (1 and 2), the sequels were not good.. But this reboot worked for me. It was fun, cheesy and very Disney.

I probably won't ever watch it again, but I'll have trouble stopping my kids!

Being roughly Macaulay Culkin's age, I fully remember the impact that Home Alone had on kids at the time. It's perfect balance of sentimentality and slapstick made it an event upon it's release and endlessly re-watchable when it would inevitably pop up on cable each Christmas. It's goofy, but well made enough that it stands the test of time, and I can't imagine why any modern kid would be pinning for an update, unless they seriously just can't imagine a world without an Alexa. Which begs the question of who this remake is even for, when old folks like me long grew out of it and knew well enough to stay away from the endless sequels that trickled out over the years.

But for anyone who seems visibly angered by this films existence, I urge you to consider this: Home Sweet Home Alone didn't even have a theatrical release, so no one forced you to spend 15 bucks to sit in a dark room giving it your undivided attention. If you have Disney+, it just appeared one day for free, and it was obvious what it was gonna be; holiday fluff you could stick on in the background and still be able to follow while you finish some Christmas chores or nurse an eggnog hangover.

Sure, making the burglars sympathetic doesn't work as well as real bad guys, but there's literally 3 other movies that you already didn't watch that have that exact premise, so at least they tried something new. Sure, she's no Joe Pesci, but Ellie Kemper's patented over acting does fit the intended cartoonish tone. Sure there are some childish jokes and stretches of logic, but this is a Home Alone movie after all. It's got a bigger budget than the last two, so it doesn't reek of "made for TV movie". There's a couple easter eggs that nod towards the first film, and their incorporation of the John Williams score does trigger some nostalgia.

If you want a timeless family classic, just watch the original, again. If you've seen it too recently and want some light Yuletide pablum that tells a familiar story without challenging your brain in any way, well then this exists.

From Home Alone 3 and onwards the series have just been worse and worse. With no expectations this film was so much better then the other sequels. I would really recommend more people to see this and form their own opinion.

Yes they did it again. It's the same old story but there's so many new traps and hilarious ways of hurting the inept house raiders. It starts of a bit slow but stick with it for some really good slapstick action.

Okay so this movie wasn't awful but it completely rewrites the premise of Hone Alone!

In the original, Kevin was a hero defending his house against two burglars. If they wanted to be successful, they should of gotten McCauley Culkin back. A fresh story that revolves around him and his son with the older villains.

Not sure what the point of this film was unfortunately, could have been so much better.
Ignore the crybabies this isn't a remake of home alone 1 & 2. They were creative with the story and it was entertaining and funny. It was a good family film. Watch it.

review_title: Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney were hysterical
review_detailed_main: The movie was funny. It would have been better not as a Home Alone movie though. The kid was the true villain in this one. The movie would have worked better if it just focused on Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney. Worth a watch.

Overall this really was a miss. There were some cool connections and feelings of nostalgia to the original but it was largely just bad writing, a pointless story line, and the kid wasn't even the main character or likeable.

I don't understand why they keep trying to recreate the Home Alone movies. It's never going to happen. The first two were phenomenal and will never be matched.

This one was better than the previous few, but it's still not a patch on the original two.

In fact, I'd guess that if this hadn't boasted the "Home Alone" title, that it probably would've gone mostly unknown.
In stead of Kevin what did you do to my room, Disney what did you do to this movie.. Cheap knock of. Disgraceful reuse of the classic music in this zero feeling Christmas Movie.

review_title: I really wanted to watch a bad movie.
review_detailed_main: Some events happend and they were all so forgetful. They tried but no way near those two originals. The kid and the adults tried so hard to create that practical pranks funny but they were all so cringy. The whole thing was just displeasing.
Started with stupidly funny but quickly lost the funny & just left with stupid. And there's no good side either, since the kid is a loser & the other couple are dumbasses.

Better than these reviews suggest. I've seen the first 2 about a hundred times over the last 30 years and have never had an interest in the straight to dvd sequels. My kid wanted to see this one and going in with low expectations I was pleasantly surprised. Decent budget, decent cast and a few nods to the original. Worth a watch.

I normally wouldnt submit a review but I found that after watching this movie I really wanted to recommend it to as many viewers as possible. No, it's not as good as the original home alone. But what is? How can any movie match the incredible originality and performances of Home Alone. It is a classic. This movie is a great streaming movie and the cast turns in memorable performances. If you have Disney+ go ahead and watch it, I know you'll enjoy, as an alternative to the hundreds of traditional Christmas feature.

review_title: Kids will enjoy it more than adults
review_detailed_main: Kids will enjoy this more, I've seen from most reviews people slate it because they compare it to the 1990s Home Alone movies ... Made 30 years ago! Kids see those classic films and consider them looking dated. Like adults see 1970s and 80s movies dated. It may be the usual recipe, a kid left at home to stop burglars but what would they expect?!? It's like saying heist and spy movies copy each other. It's a good family movie, some funny moments, just the kid's weird English accent is bad, and I live in London.
All the problem begin from the kid, not like the REAL home alone movies. The kid just being annoying and stupid to innocent persons. The storyline are blur, very cringe, no logic.

It's basically the rich kid vs struggling parents trying to do right during Christmas time. Rich vs poor is not a good look for Disney at this time (or anytime).

Would not watch it ever again.

I expected it to be bad but then I went in with an open mind and an impartial opinion but gosh, was I extra disappointed. The kid was annoying, the acting was terrible, the comedy was bland and dry, this even gives slapstick comedy a bad name. Humour could not be found in the pathetic display of traps and injury. Even as irony, it has failed.

I suggest that they stop trying to remake the classics, when something is broken, you do not fix it. The original is a timeless classic and does well to carry itself, even in the new generation and new audiences. I feel bad for the kid that has to watch this and think that this is the peak.

Snotty little rich kid and struggling family. I didn't care much about the original, but this one is bad. I literally don't even care that they broke and entered but there's nothing you can do to convince me that a gross, wealthy child is in the right here.

review_title: Try As They May, But Will Never Live Up To Home Alone or Home Alone 2
review_detailed_main:
Disney acquired the rights to the Home Alone franchise when they subsequently purchased 20th Century Fox in 2019, in of the biggest mergers in Hollywood history. Of course Disney wasn't going to waste an opportunity milking the franchise, but this installment does rate somewhat better than previous releases, like Home Alone 3. The writers of this film were creative enough to add some subtle links to the Chris Columbus helmed films of the 1990s, which is fun if you're a fan. But the subtleties are so quick, you may not notice them.

The other downside of Disney owning the franchise rights now, and this film being released to Disney+, you have to be a Disney+ subscriber in order to see the movie. Unless you know someone! Disney could make a bundle of money if they released to disc some of the content they have on their streaming platform.

Anyway, the story isn't completely original, a rehashing of the 'thieves stealing from a kid who sets up traps' mantra. The best parts are the tidbits linking the McAllister family. But it will never live up to the original Home Alone, or the superiority of Home Alone 2 (which was a masterpiece of casting and creativity).

First of all, the movie is so boring, its like watching paint dry.

Second, the actors look so forced, and it looks like they are reading cardboard cutouts disintegrating in the rain.

Its like they have little to no skills of acting at all.

It's a pretty good comeback for this franchise. Although nothing can beat the original, I really liked it! The kid is hilarious but can also be pretty annoying. I honestly think people are looking at this film in a wrong point of view. It'd be better as a standalone movie than a home alone movie.

Of course this film will never be as good as the first two, but they even make a joke about this in the film. I did think it would be terrible but there were some funny moments and kept with the original theme. I enjoyed the Easter eggs.
The plot made no sense. Every bit of the plot was unjustified. And the ending made no sense. This movie could not even hold the attention of my 5 and 7 years olds.

review_title: Instead of sympathizing with the family that's going through financial issues and trying to make ends meet, the movie wants us to root for the spoiled rich bastard
Made an account just to downrate this
review_detailed_main: Absolutely terrible movie about a spoiled brat kid. The humor was poor, the "traps" were painfully masochistic, and this had absolutely none of the charisma and creative quick wit of the original movie. I watched it more so to see how cringy it was and it just left me mad that someone actually OK'ed this plot and thought it would make for a good movie. I've never reviewed a movie but I actually went out of my way here just to give this a poor review if that gives you any idea how terrible of a movie it actually was.
Gave it 10 minutes before turning it off the acting was god awful. The main kid wow that kid was awful!!!! Overall a hot mess. Even the 6 year old said it's bad and told Me to turn it off.

review_title: If only it's not titled "Home Alone"..
review_detailed_main: A nice, fun Christmas movie to watch along with the wholr family. I think if only it's not made as part of the Home Alone franchise, the review score would be better. Adding the original Home Alone soundtracks here and therr kinda bring back memories and worth +1 score for me.

review_title: Time to damage your childhood movie !
review_detailed_main:
So weak actors, weak screenplay, week director.

This is a scene by scene copy from original home alone movie. So dont waste your time and your money for watch this poor movie.

review_title: Give it a try, it's actually good
review_detailed_main: It doesn't try to be home alone. It shows homage to the original. Yet it does it's own thing, and it's funny. I was thoroughly entertained, for something refreshing and new like this. Watch with an open mind and just enjoy. I definitely recommend. Do not listen to the negative reviews.

review_title: This film has no charm whatsoever.
review_detailed_main:
This film has no charm whatsoever.

Grown up jokes about "the Cloud" soon run dry

The over-acting is rather freaky (and shrieky!!) at times

And I doubt most child viewers will relate to a kid who dresses, talks, and acts like an adult

Where has the magic and light-heartedness gone, Disney?

review_title: That's... not how you make a home alone movie
review_detailed_main:
The kid protagonist in this movie is atrocious, and not only that, but it doesn't show us that he's learned that his behavior is not good.

This film makes the so-called "burglars" sympathetic characters, while they make the kid an annoying little prick that you just want him to get hurt. I don't see any enjoyment watching two people (who didn't do anything bad after all) getting tortured by an eight year old - hell, it might even be cringe worthy for little kids. It's generally not a film that has received positive criticism from the majority of the viewers and critics, and I can see why. The 10 star reviews here are just some rare exceptions, or maybe people who don't know what they're saying - I personally found no enjoyment while watching this.

Just don't do watch it - the plot doesn't make any sense and the characters are either dull or idiotic. You may enjoy the traps in the third act (Maybe, although I doubt since the burglars are quite sympathetic here) along with some jokes here and there, but that's it. Just watch the first three movies - I find them a lot better than this cringe worthy sequel.

Missed everything that made the original movie so great. Everything.

If you're going to remake a movie and put such little effort into how's it constructed from plot to casting to writing and more; why would I choose to watch this one over the original?

Just watch the first two home alone movies... next.

Trying to do an exact remake of a hit while pushing the political correctness agenda will end up doing just what it did...a complete and utter fail of a movie. What a POS movie. Too bad i cant rate this film negative.
Where is the minus button! Whoever dreamt this utter trash attempt at a remake wants bull whipping!! 🙄 Shameful attempt to remake a classic!! Do not waste your time!!!

Forget the first movie... same-same but different.

The jokes are funny, which great one-liners.

I thought I was going to hate it, but I really enjoyed it.

review_title: Better than others will have you believe

review_detailed_main: I am halfway through this movie and am sorely tempted to forget about the rest. It is frantic, unfunny and confusing since the "bad" guys (I should say "couple"!) are actually good guys, while the supposably good and likeable kid turns out to be an unlikeable brat. So any trap he sets makes me wince because I can't stand the idea that the couple should get hurt simply because they are attempting to recover a valuable doll they believe has been stolen from them. Of course, the whole scenario is ridiculously unlikely. Everything could have been solved in a quick and amiable way but then it wouldn't have been a "Home Alone" movie. Well, actually it strays so far from the original concept that it isn't anything but a cheap attempt to attract more viewers through the title. It's nothing like the first two movies.

review_title: Everything wrong with the modern world in 90 minutes
review_detailed_main:
So here we are again, another Disney cash grab and my word they grabbed some cash in this movie, product placements for bmw, nordtrack, McDonald's, Uber amongst others. This kind of caper should be out of place in a family film but makes perfect sense in this picture.

Let's not forget the ever present woke elements, multiracial family (laughably predictable) check, the ever present useless retarded dad who is a bumbling unemployed failure check. Headstrong working mum check, feral children with no respect for adults check (shot in the face with nerf guns). Why are these same tired tropes given air time in every movie... why???

The fat speccy eyed English kid was obnoxious, rude and could illicit no other emotion than distain from the viewer. In stark contrast Kevin was an affable cheeky warm hearted kid and you cared about his actual well-being.

You also felt for Kevin's mum in the original as there was actual narrative to her despair at losing her child and her efforts to reunite with him at enormous physical and emotional cost to her. This is a story arc and illicites feeling for her character, this element is completely missing in this version, she has a Karen, gets a flight and hates the fat guy next to her on the flight home.

Just do yourself a favour and watch our 1990 version and feel good about yourself and your family!
Really, the only thing interesting about the movie was the music, which is in every other Christmas move. This movie brought nothing to the table. Thank God it was free.

An unnecessary and cynical repackaging showing no respect for the original film.

This really shouldn't be hard: find a cute kid (and they have, in the form of Jojo Rabbit's Archie Yates), and then string together a few comically implausible ways to injure another human being.

review_title: If your gonna remake something, at least make it good
review_detailed_main: I watched this movie not expecting it to be like the classic home alone's. But I at least expected it to make sense. A lot of details just didn't make sense. From the kids not seeing the realtor signs around the neighborhood therefore not not knowing that their parents were selling their home. To the parents becoming hard core criminals because they couldn't ring a door bell or wait until the owners returned. And who voted to cast harry potter? Just terrible. The only thing I liked was the appearance of buzz. And shame on the creators for making that boy dress in women clothing. Terrible just terrible.

While this does not at all compare to the first 2 Home Alone movies, my family and I found it entertaining. I personally liked the parents and their dynamic and how they tried so hard to save their home. They were an average every day family, not rich like the Mc Allisters which made their quest more relatable. Maybe my review may not align with the rest of the negative reviews but I didn't find this movie as bad as stated. It's another fun and quirky movie to watch during Christmas time and we have added it to our list of movies that we like to watch during the holiday season. Again it doesn't compare to the classical, but we liked it.

It doesn't even come close to comparing to the original Home Alone. My almost 8 year loved the original. He said half way through this one he was done watching it because it was terrible. I completely agree. Not funny. The kid isn't that great of an actor in this movie. The tricks played on the man and woman wasn't good. Terrible acting!

Nothing will be as good as the first two but this did a great job for a 2021 Home Alone movie. There were tons of little Easter egg moments. It was funny. The parents were great and relatable. People giving it a bad review and saying it's terrible wouldn't have been happy unless they just watched Home Alone 1990 again. It was similar enough to be considered a Home Alone movie and different enough to not seem like a repeat. They were smart to focus more on the desperate parents opposed to the kid because no one could pull off what Macaulay did but the child actor in this was still great. Give it a try with an open mind and you might be surprised!

Obviously, the original two with Macaulay Culkin where the best most iconic movies, so don't even compare those movies with this new one.

I think the perspective on this one was new and interesting because you want to "side" with the criminals since they're good people; they just wanted their expensive doll back that was supposedly stolen buy the main kid, Max. In the beginning, Max isn't that much of a likable character to the audience unlike the original Kevin, so it was harder to watch. And the couple was ok, but they annoyed me because of how dumb and immature they were even though they were supposed to be the humble adults.

I thought the cameo of Buzz was funny, and they were even making fun of the movie because they said something like "why make a remake, the original is always better" or something like that. The music is familiar and there's a lot of Home Alone references in it which is cute.

The iconic booby trap scene didn't have a lot of build up to it, it just felt kind of meh and wasn't OMG. Wasn't as exciting, but they couldn't make the traps that deathly in the movie because the "criminals" are good people.

Overall, this movie would be good for younger kids to watch with the family. The younger generation would understand the jokes more because there's some weird "trendy" humor in it.

Before I even watched the this thing they call a movie, I knew it was going to be poorly executed. I don't know how many movies they are going to try and base of the original Home Alone movies, but they should really stop. The kid who terribly attempted to be Kevin's character needs to give up acting entirely. I have never been more made when watching a movie. The production made it look like it was a film done by one of my classmates in multimedia class. In all honesty it took away all of my holiday cheer. I think I no longer want to celebrate Christmas thanks to this insanely bad movie. I don't even know anything other words to describe this trashy movie.

review_title: It is not disappoing...because I knew that this was a disaster.
review_detailed_main:
Take Home Alone, remove all of the human connections and emotions. Build a home in a studio and write some idiot script around building whith a kid and some Macguffin (a doll), what the neighbours want to take back from the kid.

The original wasn't the smartest film, but at least it was funny and it has a heart. There was a mother who wants her kid back, the strange killer neighbour, who actually s a very good person. There was John Candy.

In the new one all of the human connections are lost. The acting was over the line, even the protagonist Archie Yates, who is a nice kid, bad his acting here is really bad. But it is not his fault. In this film everybody and everything is bad. Even the cameo from the original movie placed here stupidly.

Thank you disney, you kill everything for a couple dollars.

An insult to the original. Almost unwatchable. Please don't.

The acting for the most part is shocking. The characters are unlikeable and the humour seems to have been left on the cutting room floor.

Christmas movies should be better than this.

What the hell is even this movie, I didn't expect much but wow. They're trying soo hard to be funny, and just missed out every point on home alone movies. You guys need to not even fired the writer, you need to sue them for making this way worse than I expected.

Pretty sure the writers forgot that the reason we liked the first one is because it was two cartoonishly evil burglars getting their comeuppance and not two working class people getting horribly maimed by some rich brat.

Watch without prejudice and you'll enjoy it. We did. Shame all the bad reviewers can't. Rob Delaney and Ellie Kemper are great. Archie Yates isn't obnoxious. Perhaps could have done more of Aisling Bea.

First half was good coz the other character except for the boy did great. After the two characters enter the home, it gets so annoying. The boy's role is very rude and unpleasant to watch and no comedy at all.
I think this version is hilarious. It starts off slow but the pranks are really funny. Over all its cute. But not as good as the first 2 originals but better than the rest of them.

Maybe you have to be a kid-haver to find this amusing, but all the negative reviews on here are being a bit dramatic. Let's face it, for a pandemic movie, this isn't all that bad. Theres been plenty of junk peddled in movies and TV (La Brea, that show is such junk). This movie has enough jokes and silliness for all ages. Give it a whirl, you might enjoy it.

The flaw was the initial concept. The "bad guys" had a just, almost noble purpose and the "good guy" was an annoying brat. Not funny. Not enjoyable. The film elicited one smile but that was all. Not worth the time.

3.7/10 IMDB got this right. It's like the McDonalds of movies. You went into this knowing you wouldn't get anything good, but not anything bad. If you saw the trailers you knew that this movie would have lots of cringe.

Contary to belief, the kid was actually just fine. He was a kid, being a kid. No other way to put it. I'd give him a 75%.

Does it deserve some of the slack it gets? No! Most of it? Absolutely!
This is the baddest movie ive ever seen. Dont watch it people. Hoe can you make so stupide movie. I wasted 1,5 hours of my life. It dont Comes by the original home alone.

If this story line has been written by students, maybe they would get a C. But instead, it was approved by millionaire studio execs and produced by people that are highly unqualified for their jobs. The circle of stupidity continues. In an artistic field, if management has no talented and unqualified for their industry because all they did was bring coffee to someone for 5 years before being given a producer title, they do not have a clue whether or not the art of the writer, director, DP or editor is of good quality or not. I am sure there are wonderful writers and producers that would make a great film but alas they were not friends with the right group of morons. These days all the expert real talent in LA ends up on YouTube instead of being hired by execs that actually need them.

review_title: The best Home Alone after the 2 original
review_detailed_main: I don't get why people hate is so much. I watched all the Home Alone movies. The first 2 is sensational, unrepeatable. So don't watch the others with the same eye. We have a lot of memories from the first 2 movies, any movie won't replace the feeling. But this, sixth movie of the frenchise is not bad at all. It's cliché, it has some irritating script, but funny and cute in the same time. I love the twist of the burglars. There are some funny feedback to the originals. They use some of the music we all know, it's a nostalgic one and a half hour movie, easy to watch. It has it's own weaknesses, like the actor's play, or some stupid script action, but from all the 6 movie, this is my third one. Every year, I will watch the first episode on Christmas Eve, the second one on December 25, and maybe from the third year, this will be my Dec 26 movie.
This was the worst Movie I have ever seen on my life. It was actually funny. These actors are so talented and their talent was wasted on this movie. I would be embarrassed.

But after watching Home Alone 4 (which was the worst movie I have ever seen) This wasn't bad at all.

All the kids did a great job!

Good attempt is what I'd say, and awesome to see the real Buzz in the policeman role (his food habits haven't changed a bit).

I don't think any movie can beat the first and second movie which easily is a 10/10 from me. It had synergies that are very rare these days, and we're not likely to ever get that magic back.

I initially thought about 6 stars, but it had a vibe to it at the end that I really enjoyed.

The kid perished in the garage from carbon monoxide. He was stuck in purgatory. His mother never actually left and was mentally unstable. This explains why she thought she needed to speak Japanese to an American airlines attendant. The burglars were just an excuse to explain the missing lid. If this plot sounds ridiculous then the movie will make you critically insane.

review_title: Sometimes you gotta leave a franchise alone
review_detailed_main: This is a classic example where the studio execs can't fathom leaving Home Alone alone. The direction is flimsy, the acting sub par and there's no originality or thought put into the screenplay. Maybe your 5 year old nephew may get a kick out of this, otherwise it's not worth wasting time over.

This movie really need to rethink the masterpiece Home Alone 1 was. The whole point of the criminals were that they were stupid and actual criminals so I could laugh at them getting their butts kicked. The so called "criminals" in this move were just a couple trying to get their doll back to sell it and get the money to continue living and feed their children. How could I laugh at them getting their butts kicked when it is actually depressing? Why did they have to make everyone feel bad for them and yet make them seem like the villain at the same time. I honestly don't understand this movie and I think it's time to stop making them. I mean we're at #7 now and they're just getting worse.

To be honest I didn't watch the whole movie! My fiance is a fan of the other movies so we figured we would watch it but after about 30 minutes in we couldn't take it and had to turn it off. That was awful.

review_title: Man! I could have watched this on Christmas!
review_detailed_main:
Do I want to say Christmas classic? I don't know about that, but I felt it had all the stuff that makes for a heartwarming Christmas tale.

Its not going to beat the original, but it makes up for Home Alone 3, right? I did love the connection this movie does make to the original. Those were some cool moments.

Funny thing is, I don't necessarily see this new kid Max as being less hostile to his robbers Pam and Jeff. I was expecting the violence to be toned down because of the complaints Home Alone got for how Kevin went at it on the Wet Bandits, a duo of thieves trying to rob Kevin's house and seemed willing to kill him to do it, mind you. At least Pam and Jeff had a very justifiable and very Christmas perfect reason to need to break into Max's house. It feels like they tried to tone down the punishment, but I don't see how you can make this kind of movie without someone getting hurt bad, which is done on a less cartoonish effect but still...

Well at best this was a decent Christmas movie that came way too early proving how we are totally trying to wipe out Thanksgiving.

Idk why there are so many Debbie Downers about this movie but I thought it was great, far better than any other sequel. The only reason I can tolerate the second one is because of Tim Curry. This storyline is cute and not an exact copy of the original so that gets bonus points from me. The perfect way to revamp the original franchise without just blatantly redoing it. The other sequels beyond that are, naturally, terrible. Of course it's not going to be in the ball park of the OG because it was *that* good to those of us who grew up with it and have sentimental value over it. But is it really THAT bad, to have 3.5 stars? Not a chance. People just love to hate 🤷‍♀️
They will never replace first two ever even part 3 was better. All I got to say is it was not funny at all. They need to give up on home alone quit while they are ahead.

I love this movie! I learned how to adjusting the present instead dwelling in the past. I learned something that there is no remake. Just history repeating but this time the battle plan and break in was all misunderstanding which make it funnier! I like this one better than the original.

I sat down to watch this with my 9yo with very low expectations. I soon found myself putting my phone down and watching it. I grew up with the originals and they were and are among my favorite Christmas movies so again, I was skeptical. It was very clever and did not spoil the magic of the originals for me at all. I only wish they were able to get more of the original actors for cameos. I found it hilarious and if Harry and Marv watch this in prison they will definitely be wincing in pain!

review_title: Home alone fun with a twist
review_detailed_main: Liked the couple links they had to the original Home Alones, enjoyed the fresh twist on it, the booby traps where a little to copy cat for me something fresher would have been nice, and they could have done better with the battle damage on the characters, the ending was kind of rushed, but this is basically a TV movie not a big production, geared to bring back memories and get one in the holiday spirit and it done well with that.

Home Sweet Home Alone is not only debatably no different than the third film and the other two reboots but also by far, the worst Disney Plus movie I've seen. Yes, there can be a bit of a timeline years later after the first two Home Alone films. But this movie doesn't care to make anything new out of Home Alone that's actually about the future of Kevin and his family. Instead, this movie regards to be trendy for the children with modern technology and toys. Since this is a reboot to Home Alone, it's no surprise the story is lazily written. The characters are all annoying and their connection is illogical. All we see the "villains" of the movie we see is just break into Max's house just for a valuable doll. Seriously, there are much better ways to make the villains that's not the McKenzies. And the big problem, the humor. I think this has the worst comedy of the year. The movie would supply pop culture references, gross jokes, repeated jokes and a large amount of slapstick. Do I really need to make a recommendation? Just skip this film and go with the first two. Even if the second was the same as the first, at least it was much more tolerable than the other reboots like this one. I thought America The Motion Picture wasn't funny, but this film take the cake as the most unfunny movie of the year. At this rate, Fox should hold down from making anymore Home Alone movies.

Imagine Home Alone where they spend all of the time in the movie setting up the burglars as good guys and then hit them with the same "theyd be dead if this wasnt cartoon logic" booby traps as the others. What a disaster! Hire better writers!

What a stupid, nonsensical remake nobody asked for and nobody wants or needs. Almost everything is wrong with that film. One raises sympathy with the villains and wishes they finally get the chance to spank that little brat. I don't feel anything for him and his parents. Kevin's mom suffered mentally and physically getting home to her son whereas this discount mother struggles with discount John Candy in a plane sitting next to her about.....nothing. Not one single joke made me laugh. I don't know who this characters are and after 10 minutes or so I really don't care anymore. Why aren't "the villains" just waiting for the family to come home from vacation to get that puppet back? Why should I want to see discount Kevin fight against a couple who are the only ones with understandable motivations? I could go on, but I think it's clear what's my point here. Another classic pop culture flick ruined by Disney. Spank that brat. Spank Disney.

I came into this movie with extremely low expectations, and it actually wasn't quite as bad as I thought it might be, but it was still pretty bad.

The movie attempts to stir up the basic Home Alone formula by focusing most of the movie on the Burglars, who in this case are just a down on their luck Suburban Couple who are under the impression that the Kid stole a valuable doll from their house. The problem with this approach, is that it makes the viewer way more sympathetic to these characters, who aren't Eagle Scouts, but lack any actual malice. So it's not fun to watch them get hurt by the traps, it's just sad.

Another problem is that this leaves Max very under-developed and much less the sympathetic underdog that Kevin was. The actor is clearly older, and never really seems scared or worried about his predicament. His Family is also very under-developed. If you blink you'll miss his Dad, it's not clear who everyone in the Family even is. You never see a Cousin or Sibling ever being mean to him or worry about him being home alone. Basically, Max has a little fun in the house, then gets bored, and starts to miss his family a bit. This is like 10 minutes tops of screen time.

So, despite some attempts to shake things up, the only thing this changes from the original is that it makes the Kid less likable and the Burglars more sympathetic, so it's not clear who we're even supposed to be rooting for.

The film did have some funny moments, and I thought the cast did the best they could. But I would skip this one.

review_title: How can you mess up even this...
A comedy of errors, but without laughs
The first Home Alone film that had me routing for the invaders
review_detailed_main:
As pretty much every other review has said, this is not comparable to the original Home Alone films. Even the third film had bad guys you wanted to lose. But here, they've put so much development into the McKenzies - Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney - that Nick Frosts love child (Archie Yates) is left as more of an annoyance than some avenging angel defending his home.

If anything, this film could have benefitted from Simon Pegg writing the script; at least you'd know there was supposed to be zombies in the film. The rest of Maxs family are vapid, just like Rob McKenzies brothers family, reminiscent of National Lampoons Christmas Vacation. Even the presence of SNL stalwart Kenan Thompson can't bring it up.

The premise is much the same as previous iterations; extended family goes on holiday, forget the son who wishes to be on their own and shenanigans ensue. But given all the family development, the house defence gets barely any time. The cameos by a series alum gets about as much time!

Maybe a good Disney+ content filler, but the series is continuing its quality decline.

I get the service because I love the live action from the 60's and 70's, the classic Christmas and Halloween movies, Pixar and the Simpsons. I have seen the Marvel movies and the series'. I, however, will not pay the premium for some of the new movies. That's absurd. I can wait.

I really hope most of the parents have introduced the originals, though. They are a treasure. My husband was at the grocery store today and I was on the phone making dinner. There was a little boy about Kevin's age who come up to the checkout behind him with a small cart. He was wearing winterwear with a pompom-topped stocking cap. He put the separation bar down and my husband looked at him and said to the checker, "Kevin McCallister". She apparently gave him a dumbfounded look. He said to me he was waiting for him to take a Stouffer's Mac and Cheese out of the cart. (Yes, the mother was there, she ran back to get something.). So sad, a young person not knowing who Kevin is.😱

I digress...if you know you are going to hate it, then don't watch it and then b**** about it. Curiousity killed the cat but it doesn't kill the bottom line.

Home Sweet Home Alone is a Disney movie and a remake of the original with a modern twist. In this case a kid named Max Mercer played by Archie Yates is the villain left behind by his family. He presumably stole a valuable heirloom that belonged to Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney as they try to break in and steal it back. The story is the same as the original with all the chaos with a happy ending. The story connects with the original with Buzz McCallister (Devin Ratray) who portrays a security cop for the McCallister Security Company. Keenan Thompson acts the real estate agent who tries to help sell the out of work McKenzie's residence. The cast also includes Aisling Bea as Max's mother, Timothy Simons and the beautiful Ally Maki as the uncle and aunt as well as a brief stint by Chris Parnell and Pete Holmes. Overall it wasn't the best and I don't see myself watching it again, but it was an ok family movie that the kids might like.

Then they came out with Home Alone 3 & the last Home Alone movie to be released in the theater. I went to see it & I was so disappointed with what they did with the Home Alone series but then it only got worse when Home Alone 4 & 5 were released. They got increasingly worse as they came out so when I saw Disney Plus was doing a new Home Alone movie "Home Sweet Home Alone" I went in with the mindset that it is going to be as bad as Home Alone 3-5 BUT I was hoping that because it was Disney that they would put the magic back in the Home Alone movies & they absolutely did & I was so excited. Home Sweet Home Alone Is funny has a great story, great acting & I was so excited that they brought back a main character from Home Alone 1 & 2 & they make many references to part 1 & 2.

If you're a fan of Home Alone 1 & 2 then you will love Home Sweet Home Alone.

Like Home Alone 1 & 2 Home Sweet Home Alone will become a part of my yearly Home Alone Christmas movies. Please ignore & skip Home Alone 3-5 & just watch Home Alone 1 & 2 & 6 "Home Sweet Home Alone"

Can't stress enough how much of a waste of time this is to watch, i wouldn't even wish this on my worst enemy.

During the entire movie I was just looking at the screen, without even having a laugh, or a good time for that matter... minus one single scene that actually gave me a smile, and that because Ellie Kemper is funny.

I am not recommending watching this film, if you do no want to be disappointed.

If you want your youngling to see a Home Alone movie, the first two are the only ones that matter. Period. And maybe the third one.

The kid was obnoxious in this movie, and completely lacks that Kevin's charm, the kid from the third one is much cooler than this one, to be fair.

The movie is not funny, and you are just staring at it without having bit of fun.

The entire movie is lacking that Home Alone comedy and vibe... it is hollow... The booby traps are not as smart as they were on the other ones, and here they just feel rehashed.

It's a No.

review_title: Deserves more credit than it's been given...
review_detailed_main:
I watched this movie with my family last night, and I have to say that I disagree with a lot of the reviews on here. I have two daughters, 7 and 5, both of whom have seen the original Home Alone movie. Did it make a difference to our enjoyment of THIS movie? No.

I encourage viewers to take this movie for what it is. A fun, family romp about a big communication error. Characters are likeable, there's plenty of laughs and "hug your loved ones" moments and it certainly kept my little ones entertained!

Anyone hoping to relive the original Home Alone movie should simply watch the original. As a standalone movie, we were very satisfied and my girls are hoping to watch it again.

review_title: There's something not quite right about this film. Hopefully it funds new self-written projects for Bea and Delaney
review_detailed_main:
The script just doesn't feel right. The audience certainly isn't rooting for Max (the new Kevin) or his parents for most of the movie. The whole goody vs baddies dynamic is lost and the movie is the worse for it.

Archie Yates lacks charisma, he's slightly wooden (his performance has "school play" vibes)... but maybe it was down to terrible direction and he's actually a future Alec Guinness...? Macaulay Culkin set the bar very high, who else is going to match that levels? Macaulay also had Chris Columbus directing and a John Hughes script - so maybe Archie is better than this performance...

Ellie Kemper and Rob Delaney do all that can be done with a subpar script. I cannot say a bad thing about the fantastic Aisling Bea, she does her best too - hopefully the money from this will help fund her next self-written project.

Max's Dad, Uncle and Aunt are unmemorable and insipid.

The score is boosted to 4/10 because of a special guest appearance :) Although we could have seen more of that guest!

Oh well... I'm sure they'll try another remake!

review_detailed_main: Why Disney? Why did you ruin a classic? Smh... The movie is boring, tries too hard to replicate the fun of the classic but nope. It is hard to watch. Everything because an expensive doll lol.

Turned it off after 20 minutes. It was a bunch of good actors playing ridiculous roles. Don't know why the cast who they did. Did not make the main character likeable. Couldn't stomach to watch anymore!

review_title: To those saying it's only hated for being a remake
review_detailed_main: Why, just why. This movie isn't just terrible, it is a senseless cash grab trying to wring out every dollar of a timeless master piece to make a quick buck. It adds nothing new, it ruins classic scenes, and contains some of the worst performances I've ever seen. Terrible, terrible, terrible, the whole idea was bad but the execution makes it that much worse all these actors and producers should be ashamed.

... very bad reboot just to add christmas theme movies to the streaming platform...so sad and pathetic...everything is bad in this terrible copy of a good movie, from acting to plot and everything else. Please Disney we all know you can do it better!!! Try again!

review_title: Low expectations, and still not met.
review_detailed_main: An entirely unlikable cast, including the "Kevin" replacement who you find yourself rooting against after the first scene. There is no cuteness like the original, and no redeeming message. After watching this movie you will see the reality of the story, and have no further hope for society.

This movie. Is. TERRIBLE. I'm unsure what the need was to make a sixth installment of such a loved franchise. My daughter has absolutely loved Kevin since she was three. We have watched the original and second movies many many times and still they are enjoyable. But, there was no reason to make this "movie." The "plot" is just awful, there are no redeeming qualities. There is not a laugh to be had, every move is predictable.

Let's leave a classic alone and stop trying to remake the same thing over and over again.

review_title: Not worth the 1.5 hours running time.
review_detailed_main:
This installment of Home Alone is a poor attempt at rebooting a movie that never should have been rebooted. The original Home Alone has stood the test of time for over 30 years. Families still watch the original to this day during the Christmas season.

The acting is forced. The attempt at "comedy" is contrived and misses the mark each time. The storyline is a poor retelling of the original save for the "bad guys".

Take a cue from the rating and just watch the original.

I'll ignore all the negative reviews, they aren't worth a single dollar of anything, this movie is amazing. Even if its an RIP off, it does not matter, i'll say Dont stop at all, these movies are fun and worth it. 3 and 4 of home alone where far from same as 1 and 2, nobody got mad for that, but this you gonna be mad for? People nowadays need to stop being mad for a movie. This movie was fun. I dont see any issues here.

Watch it before you review it. Its worth it.
One of the worst movies I've ever seen. The main character is a brat and the writing is so bad. Don't waste your time watching this. Stick with the first two movies.

review_title: Good gods above it is AWFUL. SPOILERS all over.
One of the worst movies ever made
review_detailed_main: Attention Disney Plus, quality > quantity. Don't follow the Netflix model of maximum volume of content even if it's total garbage like this is. Why not do something clever like have Macauleh Culkin reprise his role?

review_title: I honestly cannot believe SNL writers wrote this.
review_detailed_main:
They completely lost all the charm of the first one while making the kid even worse and pure evil. Maybe they just hated the kid in the original so they gave him innocent targets to show how bad he really is? This rich prick of a kid steals from a poor couple with a family, the couple tries to get their important stolen item back, and the kid basically tries to kill them (like in the OG).

The key differences here are the attacks feel unjustified and cruel. They are not in self-defense, they are out of ignorance posing as self-defense. It makes the movie incredibly difficult to watch. There is no balance in the characters. Sure, Kevin McAllister was no angel, of course, but his badness was outweighed and even made necessary by the evilness of the two Chicago thugs trying to rob his house and kill him.

That made all those gags bearable to watch. That made Kevin sympathetic and impressive, even though he was doing bad things. He was doing bad things because he had to and he was a kid processing a survival scenario the only way he knew how.

This movie muddled all of that. There's no balance in it. The kid is disproportionately evil in this case, and it doesn't matter that he does something nice for them in the end. You can't even make it through to that part (I had to fast forward). I expected better from Mikey and Streeter. I trusted them to remake this classic and do it justice and what a major let down. Now, I'll know to skip their next film. My creative heart is broken on so many levels right now. I'm not even mad, I'm just disappointed.

From the beginning of the movie, I knew that the movie was bad and the actors were bad.

And whoever chose Max for this role made a very, very bad choice.

Is it impossible to make a movie like Home Alone 1 and Home Alone 2? Weird ...

Amazing cast. Horrible movie. It had promise but the falls, um, fall flat, the slapstick misses the mark and the premise is flawed. I really wanted to like this but just couldn't. They just need to leave this "franchise" alone now. 1 & 2 is all we'll ever need.

review_title: Totally opposite plot and not a good Home Alone movie

review_detailed_main:
Like Star Wars, Disney manages to suck the magic out of this franchise for the sole purpose of making more money for the shareholders. Nothing more, nothing less.

Yes it's that bad, or better said: soul less and uninspired. Sure, there will be people that like it but these are not the people that grew up with the fantastic part 1 as a child.

I quit my Disney+ subscription, I can't handle this soulless pieces of crap anymore.

review_title: What is there left to say

Watched this movie with my mom looking to make fun of a stupid Disney sequel, but came out wishing to unsee what I had just saw. This movie is one of the few movies out there that makes me wish I could pluck out my eyeballs and roast them with a rotisserie chicken.

review_title: White privileged kid doubles down after theft
Dont try to be Home Alone
review_detailed_main: Had some actual decent things going for it, but tried too hard to tie to the original Home Alone. This wouldve been better as its own thing, with only the kid left home alone concept. It was actually nice to see the "villains" of the movie not being career criminals, spies, or other such nonsense, and many jokes came so close to actually being funny...so close. All I want for Christmas this year is a little more creativity.

For me it is mind-boggling, what makes actors agree to take part in such terrible garbage, knowing the original. Is paycheck they get really worth damaged reputation? All those stupid, mindless, farting jokes that make no sense?

What a terrible end for once fun series.

Home sweet home alone Definitely doesn't hit home like the first two original movies with Macaulay Culkin, but the violence is sheer delightful even though we wish it wasn't happening to the conceived villains, because it's all purely a coincidence.

Almost like they knew it wasn't going to be great, because a character clearly said in the movie that people shouldn't remake classics. I guess they thought they'd get extra points for the self-dig. The dialogue delivery sometimes felt like they were reading off a teleprompter. It's not unwatchable, but, If you do decide to see it, you'll definitely miss the original.

review_title: Ridiculous, not in a good way

Poor casting choices, poor inclusionary tactics, over-the-top attempts at modernization, all add up to incredible disappointment. If I were John Hughes, I would recuse myself from this preponderous project.

review_title: No bad guys, kid was not cute at all either
review_detailed_main: Where to even begin? At least the 3rd one without Macaulay was decent, had a cute kid, really bad guys, high stakes, clever stuff done. There were no clever traps, nothing cool about the kid, nothing cute about him, his family was pathetic, the main characters after him were pathetic and not bad guys. So there really were no stakes, just a moronic couple trying to rob a suburban mansion unsuccessfully. Really truly not worthy of the name Home Alone, Do not watch this, let this die and be forgotten.

review_title: Macaulay Culkin must be turning in his grave.
review_detailed_main: Awful in every respect. Not one thing about this movie worked. Incredibly awkward script. Not funny. Too many characters, not enough character development. The criminals were supposed to be bad, but they weren't. The child was supposed to be likable, but he wasn't. This movie wasn't even about the child--you hardly even know him by the end. Why don't studios give a damn anymore? Slap "Home Alone" on a pile of garbage and you'll still make loads of money. Disgraceful.

Weak actors and lot's of jokes that are supposed to make you laugh...contrived and bad in every way. It seems Disney made this movie in hope for more subscribers. Too bad the movie is just a sad shadow from the previous films.
